CK7N8fkABTEyOL5CC7AY-w.text: To start the bartender Devon had the personality of a turtle.  No intensity, no emotion.  I had to asked if we could order and for her to wipe off the bar. We got our food, we both had the same thing a tortilla wrap, one of the tortillas was completely burned. I Sent it back they brought it back more burnt than the first time.  Second time When they brought  it back I opened it up and they just flipped the tortilla over!

BiC108j0slhQfrnscxpYIg.text: While the aesthetic is nice and the lavender lemonade is delicious, the food and service left much to be desired. My chicken salad wrap was dry and the side "salad" didn't even have dressing on it! Way over priced and the staff seemed confused the whole time. Just go to Pita Jungle across the street.

JjT_PnBs6Rv10Ku-5jo7aw.text: We decided to go to Farm and Craft because they had vegan options and three of our party of six were vegans. That is the best thing I can say about the place. The food we were served was cold. The service was mediocre at best. The restaurant wasn't busy. We ordered drinks. No one ever came back to see if we needed refills or even if we wanted to order another beer. The portions were small for the price ($18 for 3 chicken tacos). I don't think I will ever go back and wouldn't recommend it to one else.

KBuz9Ye2182FzZn-GYXTmQ.text: I was excited to try this place after looking over the menu they posted on their website. I love the concept of fresh ingredients that are healthy and sustainably sourced. The "cold pressed" cocktails and juices looked amazing!   After walking in I first noticed the modern and fun decorations, followed instantly by the insanely loud music. It was RIDICULOUS how loud it was and I couldn't even hear the person next to me. After being there for 5 minutes, we had enough and our party of 6 walked out. We apologized to the server, who mentioned she too thought it was too loud and had mentioned it to the manager, but to no avail. Their "about" section on their webpage states that after 5pm, they turn down the lights and offer a full dining experience. Perhaps they should consider turning down the music as well.

ckDDgCR9K0x3Mm_L1pjJFQ.text: So disappointed! The last time I was here, the food was great! This time was so subpar I wasn't sure if I  was at the same restaurant.  The Veges were so overdone and the quinoa was so so so salty. The almond coconut coffee was over sweet.  Would not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious bowl of goodness!

XiHS_lBG4UpGlUwMyuj9kg.text: We loved Farm and Craft ! The food was very tasty the service was top notch ! We were there for our anniversary we were treated very nicely above and beyond ! Again the food was exceptional!

cRLZ560BY6B7Nib7cyav_A.text: Short Story-Health Focused Restaurant- Organic, Hormone Free, Local Farms, Grass Fed-                     Good Food - Small Portions - Great for dieters and Ladies that Lunch!                      Youthful Help - but inexperience shows at this time- Could use more training                     Modern Fresh Bright Atmosphere but energetic and very LOUD w/Techno Music                      Whole menu isn't offered till 3 on the weekends                       Newly opened and changes could be in progress  Long Story-  We entered and were told it would be a fifteen- twenty minute wait and we were the only people waiting. The hostess asked my husband for his phone number to call him for when our table will be ready. He says I'm right here, you don't need to call me. While we are waiting we look at the menu that is posted on the wall and see many things we are interested in only to find out latter that these items aren't actually offered until 3 o'clock.   We get seated in about 5 minutes and when the hostess pulls the chair out for me I see that it is wet with three good sized spills of water. I look at the hostess and she just smiles and doesn't say or do anything.....so I unravel the silverware and dry up the chair myself. Afterwards she said she'd bring me a new napkin.  I wasn't expecting a BRUNCH Menu because the whole menu is posted on their website as of yesterday 7-16-16. We asked about the items we were interested in and our server wasn't aware that these items weren't on the menu. The server said they offer everything at 3 o'clock.  I soon receive my Strawberry and Goat Cheese Salad with added Chicken ($13.00). The spinach didn't look like packed spinach and looked farm grown because it was the bigger leaves. The strawberries were the really delicious kind and don't taste like cardboard like the kind you buy from the store. The Goat Cheese was very good quality that was mild and very creamy. The chicken was flavorful but a little dry on the end pieces. I'm guessing the amount of chicken breast was about 2 ounces. I thought it was a good salad.  My husband had the steak sandwich. He asked for horseradish instead of horseradish sauce. His sandwich came slathered with very hot horseradish. It was too hot in some places and he should have asked them to put the horseradish on the side because he didn't think someone would put the very hot horseradish on so heavy. The bread that made up the sandwich was very good. The beef in the sandwich was good but it also seemed like two ounces. An eye catching fancy vegetable salad came with the sandwich that tasted very mildly flavored.  Don't know if they do this all the time but they offered us complimentary hot fresh vegan cookies. Tasty but slightly greasy.  I would come back for the food but would prefer a patio seat when the weather is right because the music was too loud for me.   My husband would not because his platter didn't satisfy him and he complained to me that he was still hungry.  3.5 stars - in the end the food was good and this restaurant is newly opened so I rounded the stars up.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not sure if they give everyone complimentary hot fresh Vegan Cookies but they gave us them
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak Sandwich ($12.00) 7-17-16
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Goat Cheese Salad with added Chicken $13.00 (7-17-16)

9QjZtIWTXXkuB9IJG1KECg.text: Macaroni  Broccolini  Grilled chicken  Habanero kombucha   My go to dinner. Always consistent and always a 10/10

_8VoFUguLq5GtmiGCskd2w.text: Walked in for a late lunch on a warm day. The atmosphere and building are very appealing. All the windows were open. I went to the counter to order food and was greeted by the friendly cashier. She was helpful in my drink selections and had me sample a few item. I chose their brewed teas and they were amazing. I sat at the table and waited for my food. It took a while to get my food given that there weren't too many people in the building. I ordered the salmon and two asides. When I got my food I noticed the salmon was very grilled. When I started to eat it, it was over cooked and dry. I also had the mac and upon tasting it, you could taste the cheese was over cooked and had a burned taste. The best part was the broccoli with chili and cheese topping, it was perfectly cooked. I was disappointed in the quality for the 25 dollar lunch I had. The workers also did not smile or greet anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dry over cooked salmon, burned cheese in Mac.

MP4q-jukaZ1sS0GqkNyeUA.text: I'm going to leave a 5 star review because I love the food here. Especially the Strawberry & Goat Salad. Atmosphere is cool. The idea of farm to table is magnificent and I appreciate them being in business due to our dietary restrictions.   Truthfully today I wanted to leave a 2 or 3 star review, because for the second time they just decided to close early, because the restaurant was slow. It's a Friday night and you closed your restaurant at 9pm?!?!?! What?!?!? Adjust your hours if you have to, but it's very frustrating to drive to the restaurant (for the second time) to have it be closed 2 hours ahead of the posted time.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry &amp; Goat Salad w/Steak

WjK1HNylu2BFBsnRvw822A.text: Great place to eat, friendly service had a side salad & my husband had the strawberry salad we both had lemonade very refreshing on a very hot day!

yGh_OPSvHHrWzw0sGWSgGQ.text: We ordered the Avocado Hummus and salmon poke bowl and they were both good. The restaurant was  slow, we arrived around 4:15 PM but it took  long time to get the food. We ordered  fast but getting the food out took quite a while. We also ordered  the paleo brownie which was dry and lacking flavor.

cAL1NsEf7ctVkdG21sDJ-w.text: Decided to check this place out for lunch. Gorgeous 75 degree weather. It has a patio (right on Scottsdale Road, which was dusty and noisy). We ate inside but all of the windows were open and it felt great! This is a fast casual situation where you order and then they bring it to you. Serves breakfast and has a full bat menu. I went this route...choose your protein: soy, chicken, beef, or salmon. And then about 15 sides $4ea. (I ordered salmon $7 and grilled brussel sprouts with bacon). Hubby ordered  turkey wrap. Food came quickly enough. My salmon was a smallish portion, about 3 ounces, but it was thick and perfectly cooked. I was disappointed that they didnt season it! The brussel sprouts were burnt on the outside and hard/uncooked on the inside... bacon was yummy :) hubby liked his well enough. His side salad was crisp and fresh with a very light, tasty dressing, but he said he was still hungry so he bought a $3 cookie. It was good! Not sure if we will be back to give them another try. There are just so many interesting places to eat, why settle?

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WjancKb-wRsPVz1ZPC--HQ.text: My husband and I come here every Sunday after church for brunch. We usually get the protein pancakes and the American breakfast. We LOVE the sweet potato hash! Sitting outside feels like a vacation for us. Staff is always friendly and I can't believe how management is able to efficiently and thoroughly take care of these huge weekend crowds! We will continue to be regulars at the Scottsdale location and can't wait to try the new one in Phoenix.   The new crustless quiche on the menu is awesome. Try it!

1AE1eQJeCWkMcGbjqkeoKw.text: Just had a delicious paleo meal here! Had the roasted chicken, sweet potato mash, cauliflower, and a side of Brussel Sprouts. Kombucha nectarine cocktail to pair. For dessert I had the paleo brownie without ice cream. It was so good... moist, warm and chocolate-y. Everything was scrumptious and I'll be back. Food was comparable or superior to Flower Child or True Food Kitchen. Ambiance was on point. Make sure to say "hi" to Andrew, he's the best server in Phoenix-metro/Scottsdale and will go out of his way to accommodate your food restrictions/preferences.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kombucha Nectarine Cocktail

Bw8m0JPPlc005dQaKzTs5w.text: such a cute hip restaurant! I love the healthy options and all the staff is very friendly... don't get me started on the coffee so good (:

JdrcfPzxTQRSGrI_8RWi3Q.text: Very nice setting, decor is great and interior design is very welcoming. Staff were more interested in catching up with each other's stories from the bar the night before than serving the patrons, but other than the slow service they were very friendly. Food was okay, serving sizes were very small though... My acai bowl should have been about 50% bigger than it was. My wife's protein toast was passable at best: scrambled egg was cold, toast wasn't toasted through so was soggy, and there was a paltry amount of avocado spread on the toast. It wasn't bad, but I probably won't be back, there are much better places to eat in Old Town Scottsdale...

ZjU3XeHXwCwjMZ1WxDV-EA.text: If you're looking for healthy tasty elevated dishes this is your place. I live in the area & this is my new favorite spot. Farm & Craft checks all the boxes delicious food, light bright atmosphere, & great service. Ask to sit  in Drew's section he is fabulous.

ZCqIswt0TMZG1v_1FhilNQ.text: What a cute place right? Grwat location, great design, intriguing menu. Fails to deliver. The atmosphere and design is much better than the food and service.  I had the salmon today. So dry... would not recommend. I go to the chop shop next door often and i love it. This one needs a little help. Hopefully they'll get it together shortly. It has potential!

8YGA3vGHefzVBlW8-S9Tkw.text: Jake Jake Jake!! We love Jake, we were just there and he is such an asset to the restaurant!! He was so fun and so nice we def will come back just to see him... Oh and Joe too! Just because Jake said

p6RlWUzD2CUjad-23VCwbw.text: The food has beyond exceeded all of my expectations!! Absolutely incredible! Not to mention the chic and comforting atmosphere!   10 stars

MxGnba4raZ42Ni7GJescUA.text: We went there for lunch on a Friday. At this time of day it is fast casual so you order at the counter then sit down. The food still takes a while to come out though so I'm not sure why this format exists. Also, it felt a little pricey for "fast casual", we had 3 meals and one iced tea and it was $47. The pesto flat bread was really good, my mom and sister both got bowls and they were really bland and flavorless. I gave it 3 Stars because I think it's the type of place where you have to know what's good to order, and I'm willing to try it again for dinner sometime.

brtPJuKAmJPo6dCgx0q8bA.text: Had the Thursday night flatbread and bottle Of wine deal. The chicken and kale pesto flatbread was delicious!

XZYUaFOXaqZEYoI2D1yRNQ.text: Went here for the build your own bowl and got the grass fed steak and Brussels sprouts and a glass of wine. Unfortunately, money NOT well spent. My steak came out so cold as if they have extras sitting back there waiting to be ordered. The servers were so out of focus. No utensils were brought and my wine literally got filled a quarter of the way... mind you I've come here before during lunch time and ordered the same dish and drink and they were fine before. The service was so uninviting and I can't say I'll be back. For the prices charged the service and quality of food should match.

Nnv8g4A7qHh58i3u_KzWEw.text: This place was awesome! A trendy walk up restaurant with healthy food options. The place is so well done, the decor is on point, welcoming and open air. Big groups are welcome, the only reason for the missed star is the service. We ordered an iced coffee , food and a juice. The food came out on time however we had to remind the staff that we still had drinks coming, once they delivered the drinks, the latte was just a black coffee. We told the manager and she fixed the drink. I would def go back, and try it again.

CR8adncniBZXsAXuZp68Ew.text: This place seemed like a nice trendy place and food looked great on yelp. We showed up waited 15 minutes before someone came to take our order. Once we ordered our food we waited about 30 minutes before we got the food  and food was COLD, no flavor. Service was slow, coffee was also cold I asked for sugar and finally I had to get up and get it myself. The waitress never came back after she gave us the food. Once we were done I also had to go find her to pay for our bill. I understand sometime places are busy but they were not busy will no come back again.

6k1ZIN0bMw3UCygVUpNHAg.text: I just knew walking into the place that it would be a good experience all around. I recently began watching gluten consumption and this was perfect.

iTJQEQ4SteUIVS-wEBZMdw.text: Love the atmosphere and food here! I got the pancakes and they were amazing!!! I highly recommend coming here, especially for brunch because their fresh pressed cocktails are delicious.   The entire menu is very innovative and healthy, super refreshing, and surprisingly affordable for how yummy everything is!

WQ37gUqnoUmWtuXMrmn7zg.text: Fresh local food.  Everything from bread, butter, appetizers, salads, and proteins are excellent.  Everything is simply made and they allow the ingredients to speak for themselves.  The ambiance is bright, and refreshing.  Perfect for brunch or lunch.  Service is top notch.

wQuVW_v6MuZtD2JTYV4TEQ.text: Gross and over priced. My breakfast was cooked all wrong and they burnt my toast. For 35 bucks and I have to order and get my own coffee, not worth it. I'll give two stars because I do like the outdoor seating. The location would be better for someone serving comparable food. Also no Bloody Mary at a brunch location.

H6iItliQmPmToVLugPEDhA.text: The food was very fresh. The place is super open and neat. I got a lavender lemonade that was really good. I also got a juice to go that I LOVED. my dog enjoyed the patio and they have a cute toy basket and brought him water. I will say the patio is small for dogs though. The crowd is definitely on the "uppity" side but what do you expect.

HXibaDIkCvkaqPA0JTgvNg.text: Whenever my wife and I come in we are always seated promptly. It's good value for our money and I love the applewood smoked sausage. We go there often on the weekends. We love the patio! We are always checked on by seemingly every staff member in the building including the managers and we appreciate how friendly everyone is.

P2zF-U_LO2_HTPOUd3qrOQ.text: Food was good - Interesting take on steel cut oatmeal - seasoned with tumeric and fresh berries. Service was slow and not attentive.

fLgQ6bWVZKsjFeYyM2SDNg.text: Finally tried this place out today for lunch and had a delightful experience. Why has no one else thought of Kombucha cocktails before?? Stop in for a beverage and some healthy, flavorful eats

o4Kz_ePCv7li-bOEGqwI3Q.text: I really enjoy Farm & Craft... there are a bunch of reasons. Location. The location is perfect in old town. Great place to people watch and hang out at their cute bar or on the patio.  Healthy Food. The food options are all pretty healthy so you don't have to feel guilty about eating there! We started with the avocado hummus, and I have to tell you- it is delicious. My kids love it as well. I would go just for that honestly. I love their mashed cauliflower and other veggie sides as well. We went for brunch and my kids got their kids pancake. Wow! I tasted it and it was so good. It came with bacon and strawberries- the portion size was great. Drinks. I had the "forbidden" fruit which was a hollowed out watermelon with cucumber vodka. My daughter had the non alcoholic version that had coconut water in it. It was fun! I saw a couple other cocktails that I would like to try as well. They also have kombucha cocktails!!!

605SMT7VFGrUgR2Jv6xkiw.text: Amazing food!!! Very fresh and feel-good, tastes-great healthy!! Exceptionally kind service. Best hummus I ever had (avocado hummus).  Cool ambience. Don't miss it

MC6b9Bfg0gOLGatkP8Kw2w.text: Loved this place!!! Great brunch spot. Awesome food and drinks. The bartender was the kindest and nursed me back to health with her food and drinks recommendations after a night of drinking and a morning run (I am not a runner)!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich, bloody and strawberry elixir shot = hangover cured!

F_h_fhu-_tBgxPrJuuzoAw.text: Farm and Craft is the bomb. We liked it so much we ate there twice on a three-day trip to Phoenix.  The drink menu is cool and different. I tried one of the kombucha-tequila infusions and it was delicious.   The servers are hip and young. This place feels cool. I ate the vegan flatbread and the salmon and was impressed. The prices are reasonable.  Our only gripe - the TV over the bar blinks in and out every couple of seconds which is weirdly maddening if you happen to face the bar while eating. Please fix it!  Otherwise we had a great time here and would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Feeling fancy.
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegan flatbread w. soy cheese.

gMS3iMSE1sCuGwhwlCYjcw.text: This was my second time dining here! I came when they first opened and wasn't a huge fan, but decided to give it another try last week. I'm so glad I did! I'll definitely be back!   I had the breakfast crustless quiche and salad. The quiche had chicken sausage, cheese and kale. It was delicious! The side salad was mixed greens and tomatoes in a vinaigrette! I enjoyed this healthy dish!  My sister got the same thing and enjoyed hers. I'm excited to explore more of the menu next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crustless quiche and salad

coi22zRpLFKNUwDkPEZiIw.text: So so good.   The space is fresh and inviting and they have plenty of menu options for the health fanatic.  I had a Kale, sweet potato, sausage and egg white scramble with a side of bacon. My kid ate a pancake and loved it.  Smoothie could have been better but they ran out of almond milk (@ 10am) so they made it with coconut water.  Only reason it didn't get the full 5 stars.    I will stop back when in town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

d2203sL9gBvU3obFdbZ41A.text: Love it! Great atmosphere! A perfect pace for a ladies lunch or a casual meeting! Fabulous menu with healthy selections!

5MIE71mU8iXI7HYqv8fH4Q.text: It's hard to find something to complain about at Farm & Craft; maybe how popular it gets and how it maybe a little noisy from the many restaurant patrons. (Which I don't believe you should hold against them)  The food is unique and more for people who are health consciousness. If you don't know what "kale" is or if your looking for a cold draft american beer with a cheeseburger piled high with all the trimmings, I would suggest that you look elsewhere.   I was in a group of a total of 4 people and we ordered a variety of food. No complaints about any of the items.  Farm and Craft seems to had healthy delicious food in mind as well as beverages that are not loaded with sugar or artificial flavors. In a nutshell, tasty food that makes you feel good and not feel guilty after eating it.   The atmosphere is trendy and classy, the bathrooms and dining area was well maintained and clean.   Food came out in a timely manner. And priced very well when considering the high quality of ingredients and the nice look/ambiance of the dining area.  Service was fast and friendly.  I will definitely be back!

Pvp4xoj6OJPQUpDU0w1ZwQ.text: Has been several months since last here. I'm actually their first customer today and have a variety of breakfast requested. Nice setting streetside and is modern arrangement which is not particularly my favorite. But food here has always been very good. Today, the bacon is...yuk. I can't eat it. Pancake is excellent.

YohcrjTTx2A5DiJXBwLycQ.text: The food and cocktails here are fresh and light. I appreciate all of the vegan options of course. Even the alcoholic beverages make you feel like you are drinking something healthy. This was my first time at the Scottsdale location. It was pretty busy, one think I didn't like was how long we sat at our table before anyone asked us if we wanted water. Then it seemed like a long time before our waiter came over. The waiter was kind and pleasant. The food was fresh and good. I am a lover of spice so the avocado hummus was a little bland for my taste. But the spinach and artichoke dip did not disappoint it was one of the best I have ever had. I like the fact that this food is good and filling but you don't feel bloated after you leave. I recommend it especially if you have a mix of meat eaters and vegans hanging out. There is something for everyone's

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Indeed.

JSLmdU_r2QatKKbzLdXgNA.text: I was excited to try this place but the experience was very underwhelming. I came for dinner on a Monday night and while it was busy, there were plenty of open tables. Honestly, the service was really bad. We were seated quickly as we had a reservation but it was a long time before someone even approached our table to take our drink order. The waitress appeared to spend most of her time behind the computer at the front desk and we sat for about 25 minutes before she took our order. It seemed like they did not have enough wait staff or this girl was just trying to avoid doing her job.   We ordered the avocado hummus which was quite good and a nice refreshing appetizer. Other than that, the food was just okay. I love healthy food, but everything was just bland and not what I'd expect when going out to eat. I got the Tocoa Steak Bowl and others in my party ordered the fried rice. The fried rice looked very basic and the chicken was dry and bland. While the food wasn't bad, I feel like I could have made it better at home.   I didn't order drinks, but the drink menu was large and had a lot of good options. This place seems better for happy hour and drinks rather than for dinner.

hoLiApZepQ6dlYABSImKmQ.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere, and kombucha on tap! My new favorite place in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome bar!

pR2ZW0MIQkMoH81U9x90RA.text: This place is upscale and dope AF. Ambience is too good.   Ordered - Avocado hummus : tasted great and quantity was meal perfect. They gave me uncooked Cauliflower on the side which I hated.  Beets : this is just a side dish. Dressing and taste blew my mind.  Totally meets Scottsdale standards and worth a try.

Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hummus

pnCYD55A6pIt3Schg2LLHg.text: Y'all I had the most delicious gluten free breakfast burrito! It's called the breaky burrito, and I'm so glad it became one with my stomach. It was very filling. I also ordered the lavender lemonade, and I don't regret it. It quenched my thirst and calmed me at the same time! Eat here! Especially if you have a specific diet to survive.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best quote ever

QfxNythSbf_MuQZBpG2SPQ.text: Definitely love their variety of healthy food and their fun drinks while catching up with girlfriends over brunch type of vibe here. Staff is friendly and its conveniently close to everything in oldtown. Recommend 10/10 times!

Bxn2c7dis2jUyEBIMyXccA.text: Meh. Super basic.  The space is super cute and fun. The cocktails were ok but not consistent. They ran out of bubbles at Brunch?!?!  No mimosas, how do you brunch?  The food was super bland and uninspired. The service was slow.  I don't need to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Nn6S-uPEhdA3rfaPd2QQVw.text: Good food, good vibes, good service. The food was all delicious. The bacon and Brussels sprout pizza was to die for. The smoothies are also really filling and fresh. Highly recommend for a brunch/breakfast spot!

tCw6RVMBH4wTMGxPPH_IRg.text: We went here with friends this past weekend and we all realllllly loved the food.  The unique and healthy offerings were exactly why we went and the reward was delicious food.  Even the one member of our party that hates to eat "healthy" loved his burger and chicken fried rice.  I would have given 5 stars, but unfortunately the drinks weren't perfect, like the food was. Otherwise, great little place.  We will definitely be back.

FO7JHL5ZBMgo0tCrCqlmtA.text: FOOD: I have been here multiple times and I'm afraid I won't be back. It is so overpriced and to be honest not very good. $9 for one piece of avo toast that is sub par tasting and a sad excuse for a salad. They also don't have their juices available a lot of the time which I don't understand how that's possible!  SERVICE: I would say that I've never had amazing service here. It's sub par. They changed it during the week to fast casual where you walk up and order which for the prices I feel like is not justifiable.   AMBIANCE: the place is cute but I would recommend going during the weekend when they have servers and the restaurant should be more attentive to the customers at that time.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8C7Cek0wBeGGlx2VsjzmGg.text: This place is delicious, fresh, and flat out amazing!! I had been wanting to try it out for a while but haven't had a chance, until today! We came here for a work lunch and omg everything looked amazing on the menu! It's a very fresh, earthy menu with a lot of healthy options. For a lunch spot it was great, portions weren't too big but everything tasted amazing. The build your own bowl was the way to go! However, their flatbreads also looked delish! I ordered the build your own with steak, Brussel sprouts with crispy bacon bites and a wonderful white cheddar cauliflower mash! It was soo good, I already want to go back for more! It paired great with a large cold fresh lemonade (which you could refill and take to go)! My coworkers went with the bowls as well and raved about the fennel Mac and cheese, with tender chicken!  I was seeing a lot of salads ordered too and the sizes were big!! It looked like breakfast was served until 3pm too which Always is a bonus!  The patio area was nice and dog friendly!! All in all this place was wonderful! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gIGCWPPxsuH3PgJCVCurrA.text: Came here late evening for a few drinks. Service was good, waiter and hosts were friendly and seated us quickly even though it was busy. Super cute and the drink menu is very out there and different (in a good way!) The hydrator was my favorite and honestly even if the drinks wouldn't have been the best and impressed me as much as they did, the place was so cute and inviting with such a pleasant vibe I'd come back regardless.

i0N1NT2aNcx8rE5fail37g.text: My go to place in Old Town and I can feel healthy whilst drinking - Kambucha cocktail, anyone?

hbqgOoyjacyejc-KuEYKuQ.text: my experience was not the best.  I ordered a sandwich from the breakfast menu and I asked if it could be made vegetarian. All they had to do was remove the bacon....  however, 20 minutes of waiting later I find that instead of the key ingredients I received two uncooked buns with a slice of avocado and mayonnaise.   I literally laughed because I was so confused with my "meal".   but, that is not truly what made me upset. after bringing up how it wasn't really what I ordered the waitress explained how it was my fault because I changed the menu and that confuses the chefs.  what the heck! I just asked to remove the bacon - not everything but avocado and a squirt of mayonnaise. whomever is in charge of making this stuff should be able to remove bacon and for it to still be good.  my waitress was sub-par and a bit unprofessional, as of now I won't disclose their name because they may have simply been having a bad day.  On a positive note, the host was incredible. we were quick to be seated and they were quick to remove my sandwich from the tab because of its lack of sandwiching.  If you're okay with being stomped on by a rude waitress or an excuse for food, then come! because after they mess up they won't make you pay cash, just time.

-0Cw_hSXqncLPlLGSySl_g.text: Delicious, fresh drink options with a cool atmosphere and location. The watermelon drink is literally put inside a mini watermelon and is soo good! I was very impressed with this spot.

Sf6uRy6yuWXY59ofjoZHbA.text: Food was meh, very bland! Cool vibe at the place and our wait staff was very nice. My gluten free friend loved it :-) just not for me

2aoHcD624zRoDHeorH7IzA.text: I have been driving by Farm and Craft and wanting to try it for awhile. Lots of nearby street parking in this busy area.  Not much space for waiting to be seated though. Fortunately we were seated right away (11am on a Sunday) but many people milled around while they were waiting for a table. Emily was our server and she was on it- and busy. This is one of the places that it would be nice if they would just put a water carafe on the table. Their check-in yelp offer is avocado hummus which is very generous- about a $11 value.  It was scrumptious and I would have loved it even if it wasn't free. We had lavender lemonade and a kale juice- both very refreshing.  Our lunches were all delicious. They promote themselves as having fresh healthy food and it was.  It is a very loud restaurant and there is limited indoor seating so if you don't like loud music you may want to choose another place or sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kale juice and lavender lemonade
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

O17VEbw72Ha5JkJ-JpzSDg.text: We came here for late night happy hour on Friday. We had the wild mushroom flatbread which was very good. Unfortunately the kitchen was closed for any other things that we wanted to try. We had the Underwood Pinot Noir wine which was nice. I tried the Firestone 805 draft beer which was very good. Service was very excellent. Our server, Ethan, was very attentive and knowledgeable. If we ever come back to Scottsdale will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

t6I1D5GYw9ZIsALYsTRJCw.text: We stopped here after getting off the airport in Phoenix to grab a quick bite to eat before driving to Sedona. I loved the set up of the place with the quick walk up ordering and sitting anywhere you want! The restaurant itself was really cute with bright walls that really lit up the room when the sun is out.   I docked it one star because I think it is crazy overpriced for the food you get. I paid a little over $20 for a lunch for myself that didn't include a drink or sides. It was delicious but a little bit oily.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rfbT7E7r3wi0qV42qf5-Xw.text: I chose to try Farm & Craft after hiking Camelback and thank goodness this place literally brought me back to life. Some of the staff was pretty friendly and welcoming and some acted like I was the biggest inconvenience. I saw a chai beer on tap that I wanted to sample so I asked the man behind the counter what it was. I was expecting some elaborate description of the type of beer, flavors to expect (aside from the obvious chai), brewer, location, etc etc etc, but instead, all he said was, "it's a beer." Ummm...DUH!? I was a bit surprised at the attitude, but the rest of the employees were pretty friendly and a lot easier to talk to. We ended up ordering the rustic farm salmon bowl, penne mac n cheese, and the sweet potato hash and we got the avacado hummus free when I checked in. The avocado hummus is $11 on the menu so I thought that was a super generous check-in offer, and it was delicious!!! It came with yummy flax pita bread and carrot sticks and cauliflower. It was creamy and had wonderful balance of flavors and texture. The salmon bowl was also so good. The salmon was cooked nicely, a little seared around the edges so it had that nice crunch but the meat was tender. I loved the idea of pesto quinoa and it has inspired some of my cooking at home. The man n cheese was okay...the chickpea pasta was kind of crumbly but tasted good and the cheese was kind of chunky - imagine heavy cream and grated parmesan.... but the flavor was nice. I love sweet potatoes and I didn't care too much for the sweet potato hash; it had a strong grilled onion flavor and the sweet potatoes weren't very sweet or cooked enough. I ended up taking this home and repurposing it the next morning with eggs and sauteed bell peppers. Last, we ordered the gluten free brownie with vanilla coconut ice cream. HOLY SMOKES! The brownie was cakey but had melted chocolate chips baked inside that gave it a more fudgey texture. They said the ice cream was dairy free but I couldn't tell; it was AMAZING. I scarfed it down. Happy hour begins at 2pm and I would definitely go back for the salmon bowl and avocado hummus and maybe try a drink or a coffee. Beautiful open space with lots of light.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K4dQW24ISK42BZjxoPdM-w.text: The atmosphere and service was great but I wasn't a fan of the food. My best friend loved it but I felt like it was personally too bland for me and the veggies were mushy. It wasn't what I was expecting.

uDfPrVxmJQsADV6ImwPy3g.text: What a delightful surprise!  On a recent trip to Arizona, we stumbled upon this gem, just trying to find a healthier choice for breakfast. The menu is great, the presentation (I love presentation) was spot on. The food was delicious, quality ingredients, and crafted with lots of care. The music, the decor and the friendly staff was above and beyond my expectations of my accidental find. OH and that cappuccino I had was one of the best ever.  I live in Los Angeles and soooo wish Farm and Craft was here!!! I'll be back guys, I have another trip planned soon.

aW-VRkDFQ4MJ3z_v8mKhmg.text: Best breakfast option we could find in old town scottsdale. Fun atmosphere. Good food. They were out of the more interest dishes, so I had to stick to the traditional eggs, toast and hash.

kQIiJI2XUF-MsUWYmPl88A.text: Interesting place in old town - the kale/quinoa salad was very tasty - also had a cocktail called the "cure" - it, too, was quite tasty - I should have picked up one of their special juices on the way out, but failed - will do so next time!

_bapzRxe0RTEs5kond7RpA.text: This place is like a bar inside of a farm to table eatery. It was cold so we sat inside although the patio seating was welcoming. I had the salmon bowl and it did not disappoint! I had the red Cabernet - Napa and it was very good.  We were first time visitors and the clerk helped me figure it out, she was very patient. I have a peanut allergy so it takes me a little longer to order. It was a great lunch and experience.

Gwpf-ts1Uk5iOyvI-AxQ4w.text: An adorable place with a great setting in Old Town. I've had a few different dishes, and they are all light and healthy feeling. Their cocktails are fun and different than what you'll find everywhere. It's a fun place for a girls brunch or a get together. However, if you're super hungry... I don't think this is the place to go. The serving sizes are on the small side and it's definitely not hangover food (just saying). There's usually a wait too, so be prepared!

6Q1o6kG-48yNYIDfMT3Dig.text: The set up in the restaurant was interesting it's not your normal sit down restaurant you place your order with the cashier/waitress at the front and then pick a seat they then bring your food out to you. Essentially it's kind of like a more upscale fast food restaurant. The food was decent it wasn't anything over the top to write home about but the strawberry goat cheese salad was fresh and met my expectations for a "farm fresh salad." The avocado hummus wasn't that great just your average hummus platter would recommend getting something else for an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry goat cheese salad
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hummus

mUyWE8byhWyUM4qXVA3Ojw.text: A local resident said make sure you go to Arcadia Farms and order the chicken crepe. We thought we'd try it. The experience started with our host amazing host Brian gave us a quick tour of the restaurant before showing us to our charming table. Next our wonderful waitress Linda took care of our every want and need. Then the moment of truth the food arrived and it was even better than we were told it would be. In a city of wonderful restaurants this one stands out as exceptional.

NP53IYERmDgU9g8kraNU2w.text: Great Location,  friendly and attentive staff, varied menu with something for everyone, and don't forget the wonderful fruit inspired craft cocktail!

Gh38yw1Bs3BNbe0hk80nXw.text: I came in for a quick breakfast before work and I had about 45 min to kill. Went in and sat at the bar. The bartender was friendly and I ordered right away. My breakfast sandwich took 30 min and when it came out I ate half of it before realizing it had cheese on it even tho I asked for it to be taken off. I'm lactose intolerant so I probably won't be going back. Too bad because I was really excited to try it out.

Kye6CZyD4wpnxbUEA61OUg.text: Was there for dinner before 8pm, yesterday, Friday 18. We were greeted at hostess stand and seated promptly.  However, we apparently disappeared after that.  A good 5 minutes went by without even an acknowledgement "we'll be right with you".  We stood up and walked. I expressed my complaint to the hostess.  "oh, where were you seated?" As if that mattered.   "Oh, no, that's terrible".  No initiative to try correcting the opportunity.   Were they busy? No.  Tables were empty.  Wait staff and bussers around us.   We were right by the soda fountain.  Service is everything.  You failed.

MqYIV6LMw8lH3hTSESLxqA.text: I was really excited to try out Farm & Craft because of their healthy menu and the overall look of the restaurant. I went there on a Saturday afternoon around 2:30 pm with 2 friends. Surprisingly, they weren't busy as it was quite nice out. We quickly placed our orders of 3 entrees, no drinks. Our food didn't come out for 36 minutes! No reason, no apologies, no explanation. Starving, we ate our food: a salad, pancakes and avocado toast. It was very good!  However, our waitress never came back to refill our waters or to check in on us. They only time we saw her again is when she gave us our bill. When she came back, we discovered that she charged us the wrong bill amount and had to do it do a refund and run the card again for the correct amount. But at least she apologized that time! It was a very disappointing experience. While the food and atmosphere were nice, it wasn't nice enough to make me want to come back.

_tdvY05-UPZ69M5i42w-CA.text: Servers were nice but not good.  We waited a long time for food, which was weird considering that they weren't busy and only a few people eating.  First server took order and delivered food entrees, told us our side of mac n' cheese would be forthcoming.  I had the steak sandwich.  It fell apart when I took my first bite because bread was soggy.  Waited for server to come back so I could request a wrap to replace my soggy bread, but server never checked back on us.  About ten minutes later, (after my friend had finished eating) another server delivered the mac n' cheese.  I requested the wrap which she promised she would get, but it never happened.  So after another ten minutes, I gave up on that and ate my steak with a fork. My friend substituted a gluten free wrap for which they up-charged $2.50.   Bill came to $37 for two sandwiches, a side of mac n' cheese, and a beverage.  Cool concept, but over-priced and poorly executed.

lM4aottANtRm0QMCdL67hQ.text: A lot of reviews compared this to Flower Child or Chop Shop. It's not an order at the counter type of place though, you are seated an have a waiter.  Food was alright, pretty pricey for what you got. We came here for breakfast. Nothing stood out to be that great. I probably won't come back for breakfast but maybe I'll have to try their lunch out.  I ordered the avocado toast and chia pudding. Both very small.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Little baby chia pudding was also overpriced.
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado toast was good but overpriced.

qKjqUGjtKhiG8sPbwi-aaw.text: Farm and craft offers delicious and healthy food, which is a refreshing change to the usual old town scottsdale food choices. I went with a few friends and our order included the gluten free chicken salad wrap, and two of the create your own bowls. One had the salmon, Brussels sprouts, and broccolini while the other had the beef, sweet potato hash, and farro mac and cheese. All of our food was delicious as was evident by your clean plates. My favorite was the broccolini which had a hint of heat with chili flakes. All of the food was fresh, and cooked perfectly. We also had a bottle of the house rose which was crisp and refreshing. The staff was also delightful and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants delicious and flavorful healthy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Create your own bowl, salmon, Brussels sprouts and broccolini
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House sparkling rosé

vP2oPshXYcwKmBjddxfnLQ.text: The staff was super friendly and cute! The food was so good it was hard to believe it was healthy too!! Ordered the artichoke dip and the roast chicken and ate every bite. I will go back and try brunch one day!!

oZRZtIg3HCSgR7WT9udxhg.text: I am skeptical of healthy places as the food is often odd or lacking flavor but this place is not that at all. Had the steak sandwich and the "healthy" coke and both were excellent. My wife had the Rustic salmon bowl which she also loved. Host/wait staff was also very friendly. Will be coming back...

Wg6SEHf3VqnKTrisZAI4qA.text: First time here, we decided to come here because a place down the street was too pack to even try and park. I am glad we found this place it was a nice ambiance the food was delicious and fresh. So if you are wanting to eat healthy I really recommend this place. Plus the staff is friendly. It was two of us eating and our total was around $40. Will definitely be coming back!

jJfY6TLg17PxZEK6Cz3EeQ.text: This place is brand new and super cool! Fun environment and delicious food. Can't go wrong with a single menu item! If you're coming for brunch, make sure you're early because it gets packed.

jP12qrirhxupg0-FJZ5jUA.text: Love the kambucha here ! This place absolutely one of my favorite brunch spots in scottsdale. The food is fresh  and delightful. He portions are consistent love the ambiance as well

0lPcgKOv5A9sKv_oHJK44Q.text: I don't get all the hype. My dish of salmon, sweet potatoes and mashed cauliflower was simple and decent. The salmon poke bowl and protein toast seemed to be flavored over strongly with lemon. Staff was not friendly and standoffish. Not sure if it was because we were minorities or if they tend to not be nice to everyone. Won't be back.

culSEgz8p8EZO1Wgh56-VQ.text: Waited 55min for my food, there was only two of us. When I finally got my salmon bowl they forgot my side of cauliflower mash. The food was also luke   warm. Our server was very nice and brought us complimentary hummus, which is the only reason for the 2 stars. I will never come back

-KwGiEnG-yc4GvC9o-yJgQ.text: Great idea to eat to live a healthy and enriched life. They have cool menu items which are designed to address certain goals. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. They also are very accommodating for those with special diet restrictions.

erT4dHP-XBi0yWeZgbWnTA.text: I've been here several times and it's always great!  Just took my 3 kids and wife here for Mother's Day and they loved it.     Cocktails:  the cure and bloody Maria are awesome! Apps: go with the humus  Entrees:  great brunch, chicken and steak bowls, also highly recommend the steak sandwich.  The protein pancakes and protein berry smoothie are fantastic.

T5ypH2h-1VnwKtC7QnT_jg.text: Good clean food. My wife really liked it, I didn't so much. I'll go again because my wife wants to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9CT6i4nRPSBiqrfCaDSIhw.text: I'm in love with their mushroom pizza and kombucha on tap!  and on happy hour the pizza is so cheap Mon-Fri until 6pm it's only $5. I always ask for extra greens because that is what makes it for me. The first time I visited I did try a few other things but didn't really dig it but I just had to give it a 5 star because I will continue to come back for my favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The steak was good but the salad was dry
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushroom pizza is so cheap on happy hour and so so good must get!!

4QWMpgjqnrxoFaDwtB7PTw.text: Tried this place twice since I'm new to Scottsdale and all I can say is wow everything has been so fresh & delicious and the fresh healthy juices are amazing & all very tasty.. this place doesn't disappoint..

zeUPplnPu8A_lux8kpedFw.text: Been a couple of times now.   If you're a douchey, semi-pretentious bro-dawg who enjoys yelling over loud music with friends then this is your place.  In all seriousness... the restaurant is beautiful, their mimosas are some of the best but the rest is just "eh" - when mentioning how loud the music was they said "ya we get complaints about that, but it's the vibe we're going for." Ummm... ok, then.  The food is fine, nothing too exciting.

ISz4fhWHela-zNamTQUj5Q.text: Disappointed Took 1/2 hr to get our artichoke dip to share. Came with small handful of chips and six old carrot slices Regret not taking a photo $12

sqjvu2zl2MkqO3MuWZyOWA.text: Outstanding meal (rustic salmon bowl, burger, and  chicken Mac and Cheese) and wonderful service. We loved being able to eat on the patio with our dog. They have strong heaters to cut the winter chill and upbeat music. Cool open, modern space. We can't wait to go back!

4nu_v6y2gjJap66NmsBDsw.text: Not appetizing, too cheap champagne to drink, raw vegetables served, and wayyyy too expensive

WCe7R4Ne6JBgV6IRBYaJYQ.text: Great food, fun and knowledgeable staff - our server Emily was very attentive and nice. Had the rustic salmon dish and loved it. Would definitely come back and recommend to our friends.

S0kDZq0vk16lxOh4y6gFAg.text: This place has been calling my name. I live close and am all about organic whole foods. We had a large group (15) celebrating a birthday. My husband doesn't usually like this type of food (yeah, healthy lol) but he really dug the sweet potato hash. He was shocked lol. I had the spinach, black bean bowl and asked for eggs on the side so I can give to the husband (because originally he thought he was going to starve due to no substance) The waitress was spot on. Filled our glasses every time when running low. It did take awhile for the food to come out. Some of our group who ordered last had gotten their food right when the peeps who ordered first had just finished theirs. We did separate checks, and put it towards our big group. Not normal. I will def be back. The only grip is the pets. Which looked to only take place outside, thank goodness. People are allergic to pet dander, so I don't really understand the bring your pet to a relaxing get out breakfast where others are around. I love my dog, and we get out. But not at eating joints. Bars maybe.
