Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qZ3D6-Dr9bfypxKSzhmCQA.text: Farm + Craft is a great go-to for a reasonably priced, healthy meal. The food was excellent, and the atmosphere with the open glass windows was pleasant and inviting. We ordered a build-your-own bowl with roasted brussel sprouts and sweet potato hash, the tocoa bowl, and the wild mushroom flatbread. The items were all good, but the brussel sprouts were the highlight. The service was fast, and it was a perfect quick and tasty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KJDibvk7wxnXIkyu_k4gRA.text: I love the cocktails at farm and craft. They are creative, delicious and fresh. The fresh presses juices are also amazing. The good has always been high quality and tasty as well. The environment is nice, especially on the patio!

vinO4m0stWrBhTcsj3DuHQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while now. I came on a Sunday morning for brunch. The place was packed which is expected for this day of the week. Only a 15 minute wait which was surprising. The food was healthy, tastie, and presented well. I enjoyed the atmosphere. I ordered the steak bowl, it was excellent. My rating is obvious as I had no complaints with service and enjoyed my time.

H9KpyiB-WbkqghQHZVYJDQ.text: Great healthy food, small portions though. Great ambiance. We went for lunch on a Sunday, we're seated and the waiter and host forgot about us. We had to let them know we're still waiting to be served. The food came out pretty fast and was delicious. Would probably go back with the girls only, the boys complained about the portion size. Again the food tastes fresh and terrific.

IxHXlSNNF1RbaBL31KIjuQ.text: Found this little gem on Yelp and glad we tried it! The menu seems a tad confusing at 1st but the lady at the front quickly explained it to us and it became very clear. You order the style or items you want and add the protein or you're welcome to make up your own. Salads all looked great but we decided on the Cali with which had edamame, quiona, kale, cheese and we added chicken. Delicious! We thought the portion seemed small but it was plenty! We got the flatbread with artichokes, chicken, carmelized onions, fig balsamic and kale pesto. Absolutely delicious. The staff was all very nice. I'd definitely go back and try some other stuff. Lastly, when I went to refill my tea, it was in a different spot next to one of servers cutting lemons with NO gloves. Ew. I'm glad I didn't have lemon in my tea because I would've definitely said something.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

D9QRgExD6-7a6jdBowotcw.text: We hit the joint on a Thursday night to qualify for their $20 special for 1 bottle of wine and flatbread combo.  How could you go wrong? The wellness orientation was appealing. Where else can you find 6 kombucha and alcohol mixers on the menu?  The chicken tacos were really wonderful and the Kale Caesar salad was okay and perhaps the mushroom flatbread was lackluster because of the eeny-mini mushrooms.  Our waiter was kind and considerate AND attractive, largely because of his very white teeth as my dinner date explained.   The restaurant itself was also attractive with its indoor/outdoor bar and mixed seating set-up and high ceilings. Happy to have found this gem in the midst of Old town Scottsdale.

KCNx327Xw-ceKHp6wsTHiA.text: I like this place. Especially the farm mural on the wall. Food is healthy and delicious.

OP19lAVzyUcN0ORxl1NbRg.text: LOVE this place!  LOVE the design, the menu and over all vibe!  Great spot! From the Avo Toast to Acai Bowl - to the best Pancakes ever!  Only been for breakfast and lunch - and YUMMY!

qgAG_yLewpyI-uTEhj2aqA.text: While the atmosphere is nice, the salad I ate was not. The chicken was dry and the salad had no flavor. It was filled of ribs of the lettuce, when it was supposed to be a spinach salad. Might of had 5 pieces of spinach in it. I might as well have been eating a fast food salad. Yuck. I would not go back. Very disappointing.

HLu_gFEowAUXW2yiqQccxw.text: I had the best breakfast sandwich from here.  It was so good.  I like to great here at least twice a month.

O0Oo5ApKQTvkBB27JZzQHw.text: Fresh, healthy eating!  The Greek Quinoa bowl with Salmon is very fresh, light and delicious. My wife had the protein toast, also very good.

G75e4nyxAqT7LmSDAG_lUQ.text: Stopped in with mom and two teenage daughters.  Honestly I didn't know what to expect. All four of us loved it.  Really the best food I have had in Old Town Scottsdale in sometime.  I'm not a foodie but my meal was fantastic. Great waiter too.

Or6i03L9m3JvSy3yuTjU8g.text: Have been here a total of 3 times. Food is great however, every visit we have had lipstick on our glasses which was not mine. I am going to start asking for my drinks in a to-go cup. They did comp the beverages but come on, check your glasses before serving.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v10TRQ9gS0azax24wI195A.text: Delicious cocktails and the protein pancakes are so good. Regular Bloody Mary highly recommend and the cure cocktail. Chicken sausage side is so good too. I feel like it does take a while to get drinks though, but service is friendly and helpful :)

8gT8xIgDCEIrtgQI4zv8kQ.text: We were in town for two days and needed a dog friendly place. Weird that most restaurants in Scottsdale (tried Monarch & Fnb) we're not ! (Service dog only and we chEck papers!!  didn't let you order out Weird.. ) so this place was very accommodating! Bar menu was excellent! Bartender not so.. but drink was really good. Came there for the watermelon but it they were out. Hummm juice bar 30 feet behind you.. but both my choice drink and the wine were great! Shared the salmon and strawberry goat nut salad was the bomb! Hostess had the mostest!! Great lil town there lots of nightlife and almost everyone in Scottsdale were really friendly ! Fun trip and made the long drive back to LA almost bearable !

FXt_NtlXFkmMJsapOIOOKg.text: My steak was under cooked, and same steak was put on the  oven and came back black, customer service isn't great.

UFUG3tjvkcp1vaEYhU26iA.text: Hello friends!  I have been wanting to try farm and craft for a long time and have now been able to go twice in the last week or so.   The restaurant is supposed to be full service after 3pm and my friend and I found it to be so the first visit but yesterday it seemed as if they were understaffed so they told us  we had to order at that counter until 5pm.  My girlfriend and I had to open up several different tabs   yesterday for drink refills which was quite inconvenient (luckily we were paying cash).  The first time I had their rustic salmon bowl which was pretty good but I did have to add tapitio hot sauce (could have used a little more flavor and I am used to eating very clean and basic).  The most recent visit I had a strawberry salad with goat cheese and salmon and this was AHHMAZING!   Literally everything I dreamed of and more.  My friend got the salmon rustic bowl and she told me again it needed a bit more pizazz.  There was also no sunflower seeds in her bowl (they are listed on the menu) and we were told they were out.  Being in the industry I understand that things run out but sunflower seeds are inexpensive and easily sourced.  Both times we have visited we have asked for the artichoke dip out prior to our meals, but neither time did this happen (it came out with the entrees).  We love to sit on the patio to watch the people in old town and overall this is a good experience.  We will likely be back (we do love to eat clean and enjoy the atmosphere) but do have lower expectations and think for the price and the restaurant  group bringing us this concept things could be much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rustic salmon bowl, strawberry and goat cheese salad with salmon, spinach and artichoke dip, and provisioned rose!

h0EuSGsx_e7P6eQenvYLwg.text: First, I have to say that I really enjoy the food here. They have a great selection of food items and honestly I would eat here every day if it wasn't for the aggravation.   There seems to be some inconsistency with the food. Today I ordered from their website because I was in a rush and had to be at a meeting. I ordered the chicken with cauliflower mash because I am trying to adhere to a low-carb diet. Photo of menu below and what I actually got.  I get back to my office and open the box and instead of low-carb items, I have barley and high carb vegetables. Very frustrating since I skipped breakfast and basically either have to break the diet or skip it altogether.  Parking is not convenient and tough to find.  On this visit, I parked some distance away and halfway back to my car, I glanced in the bag and no silverware or napkins.  I had to walk all the way back to the restaurant.  Today was a frustrating experience on many levels.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KaAyyDzaz9UV29S0_u29yQ.text: Everything tastes super fresh and is definitely healthier than similar concepts.  However, i wasn't very impressed with the sausage & sweet potato hash, definitely lacking flavor/seasoning.  Love the Humus & pita plate.  The protein pancakes were delish! Portions are a bit on the smaller side if going for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cucumber Bloody Mary

6vBJ9rvhVjT0HXIDsDBC-w.text: The Protein Pancakes were absolutely delicious! Meant to take a picture but I ate them too quickly!  Laid back atmosphere and nothing but healthy locally sourced food options!  Will definitely be back.

TgdddeDQkaQRIqVFQTc5-A.text: Nice ambiance. Slowest service ever. And order was brought out backwards; entrees, drinks, shared plates. There were grapes in the spinach artichoke dip which was not a pleasant surprise. The juices and coconut cold brew were great though.

SAWsCb-Rjgb3kSNo7ik3Sg.text: Cute atmosphere and friendly staff has us ordering off the menu almost immediately. We were so excited to try a new place that seemed healthy! We ordered quickly and sat down to wait for our food. The food came and the presentation was amazing. To my surprise the portions were very small and the food was just above average. What we had was not worth 40.00 for lunch.

aWurnfh9N0UWBNxKeY24IQ.text: The food at Farm and Craft is really good and the service we had and customer service (Manager Jesse) at Phoenix location was beyond great. Thank you! Will go again, soon!

x1ytsA4epNTlmYMRLCojCQ.text: Come here for a fun/hip atmosphere and yummy food! The Strawberry & Goat salad is perfect if you want a light refreshing meal (I added chicken). My mom ordered the Sweet Potato Hash with Chicken Sausage and I thought it was a delicious and unique brunch option. The secret stash drink was yummy also, refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry and goat salad + chicken!! DELICIOUS.

bL2LAaCFWH_kOKxYrji_WQ.text: Delicious fresh and clean breakfast. Staff is friendly and good looking. Food was good and the juices are super tasty. My brother and I were planning on going to the breakfast club across the street but they had a 30 minute wait and we were pressed for time. We walked over to this place instead. It was perfect. It's not your typical American "overflowing breakfast plate" so if that is what you are looking for you will be disappointed. But for those with a more refined palette this is a great find.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious beet drink
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside area
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

iT8R7Cmfr0Xpr7Ae310ynA.text: Wow! What an AWESOME establishment! Every time I come here it is consistently excellent. The first time I came in, I had the protein toast. It was the perfect ratio of avocado to egg, and I had a side of bacon to go with because why not. The next time I came in I had the $20 wine and pizza deal with the kale pesto flatbread. It was delicious! I loved it so much that I got a second flatbread, the Farmhouse, to go. The service was extremely attentive, and the GM even came over throughout my stay to make sure I was satisfied. What a stellar experience, I wish I had one of these back home! I can't wait for them to expand and surely will return when I visit Scottsdale again!

hGUU-5llSc7p6WqHHzyuQg.text: Took a friend from out of town here for lunch on a Friday afternoon and we were both pleasantly surprised with the delicious offerings at this restaurant.   She ordered a bowl and I ordered veggies and chicken. Both very healthy and tasty.  We also loved the outdoor seating options!  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hand squeezed lemonade.  Perfect blend of sweet and tangy.
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The kombucha was great

B_tFpJF9Fym25gUYwzbF8A.text: The service is so astonishing bad. And then the food comes out and it's equally as disappointing. To not even have your water refilled on a boiling hot day is not a good sign and it's absolutely clear the staff had no interest in ensuring we had a good experience. We saw another table get up and leave because they had waited so long to be helped and I wish we had done the same.

hoUG54ikMLrx1tSMI5ApzQ.text: I came here with my parents as we were staying at the Hilton Garden Inn down the road.  I'm vegan and read reviews here on yelp telling me they had good vegan options. That wasn't exactly the case.  The menu didn't have many vegan options a all HOWEVER it was easy to change dishes to make them vegan so that was really a non-issue.  I had a latte with almond milk which was quite watery but other than that the food and service were really good.  It's a very clean and modern set up with both inside and outside seating.  Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  I would definitely recommend if you're looking for a yummy yet healthy breakfast!

KCZbGAHIOoMuQBH-t96A8Q.text: Delicious food. Exceptional service. Try the cocktails. I didn't get a chance to try the kombucha cocktails but will be sure to do so next time. The hydrator cocktail was so yummy, not too sweet you could have two or three. Alexis, my waitress was so great!

BfBdNBdN6_eTPwAdKy4GyA.text: I'd give it a 3.5. The decor and atmosphere are amazing but the food is a little simple/bland. It's an order at the counter and take a seat kind of place so that's always a plus. We went for weekday breakfast/brunch and I was happy with it but I don't know that I would file it in a "must come back to" restaurant.

geowkji6rw_-iJ8jeBJLLw.text: Went there yesterday for our first time. Ordered a burger, among 4 other meals. When the burger came to table I cut into it and started eating it. Soon, I had pieces that were not undercooked...but raw. Raw, like the meat you buy at grocery store and take home to cook. Not all of it was raw, but there was enough of it that I couldn't eat it and had to send it back. They did reheat it, but didn't even offer to take any part of it off the bill. Oh well, many more places in Scottsdale I can go.

S-50QRzu1V67uqrkvHmq8Q.text: Stopped here after a hike on Camelback Mountain, so we obviously had to order breakfast burritos AND a side of sweet potato hash. Perfection! The grapefruit Paloma is also a must have.

Rj1jjvObCgrAHXY5EVszJQ.text: Food is great, service is wonderful & Jackson, server, is remarkable! He's very attentive & answered all questions on the drink & food menus!! Great experience!!

fIpfvmkuOvs9r51uzYzCBQ.text: I really wanted to love this place as I run past it every morning and have watched it being built. Unfortunately, while the food is good, it's nothing remarkable. It works for me because it's fairly 'clean' and I have multiple food sensitivities, but it's just not 'right' yet. We ordered roasted seasonal veggies which came out raw. When we asked about the raw "roasted" veggies the server said they weren't roasting any veggies yet due to not having a roaster!  She should have told us that up front as we didn't want a bowl of raw veggies. Then I ordered the Rustic Bowl which was roasted veggies, quinoa and steak.  So, do they have a roaster?  Or not!  LOL My husband had the Farmhouse flatbread and he said it was really good. I like the style and idea of this place, and while not original, it was nice, simple, clean food. We may wait a few weeks and try again.

hvXQ9hs3az8HlI5lOG1YTw.text: I really liked it here! I am surprised the reviews aren't better.    Food: I thought the food was great.  I loved how their diet also pointed out different things you can eat based upon certain diets.  I am on a doctor imposed anti-inflammatory diet & it showed me what on the menu fit into that diet.  The drinks looked & sounded delicious but I can't currently drink :(  I did have the chocolate protein shake that fit pretty close to being in this crazy diet and actually tasted good.  I also go the Roast Brussel Sprouts, Broccolini with steak which was yummy!  I also got the strawberry & goat salad which was good.     Atmosphere: I thought it was quaint and felt very fresh.  It gave you that back to basic earthy feel.    Service:  Our waitress happened to be great.    Prices:  Go elsewhere if you want cheap GMO veggies from another country, meat product and other questionable chemical products.  Healthy truly "natural" food is rarely cheap these days.  Farm & Craft is in par price-wise with other restaurants similar.  Me cooking the same meal at home could possibly cost about the same here, so I didn't think the prices were bad at all.

BolVHm33EhDlNRVV-e5Atw.text: Was starving so basically ordered everything on the menu. 5 stars all around. If you don't get the steak sandwich - you're losing. Same with the farro Mac n cheese. And 8 other things. But mostly the kombucha and tequila cocktail. Finally someone got it right jn Scottsdale. Do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dmW1GUXxdMgFu_in0TrdLg.text: Came here looking for Paleo food during my recent trip to Scottsdale - was not disappointed - they have kombucha drinks and the food was great!  Love the atmosphere!

MHPiDPfjDWeMq2BKKbpWdQ.text: First and foremost, my friends and I have been wanting to try this place out for quite some time. The ambiance is the ONLY thing that is saving this place. The food is tasteless and bland. I understand it's farm to table approach, but being from the Bay Area and having access to TRUE farm to table cuisine, this place doesn't come close! The staff isn't much better. Andrew (he's vegan btw), was AMAZING! Our waitress however, was rude and was not present. We only interacted with her once (to take our order), but she seemed to have vanished during her shift. No hi. No "hello I'm so and so and I'll be helping you tonight". NADA. We will never be coming back to Farm and Craft. Overpriced and to be honest, Chop Shop next door is the same style cuisine for half the price and is terrific!

HhLfu-RF3IQip5ANfR72wQ.text: Service is super friendly, but the breakfast was pretty mediocre.  Had the egg white, kale, and sweet potato hash and the potatoes were pretty undercooked.  Maybe it was an off morning.

OluLhjvWgrBAn-5Qd3j8Dw.text: This review is for breakfast. It most likely will be suppressed by Yelp via bribes from the business (see "not recommended reviews"). Made the mistake of coming here since because of the fake Yelp rating. Horribly long wait times, staff delivering food to wrong table. Flies flying all over the food. LOUD music at 9am can't hear myself thinking. Save yourself some frustration avoid, go to New Wave Market two steps away, similar menu, better service and less pretentious.  Food: underseasoned, bland. If you're on a salt restricted diet it might be worth the wait.

N6BtxUeymNzq-gqSVkHO3Q.text: The atmosphere at farm and craft is modern country. Great location in old town Scottsdale.   The drink menu is outstanding and very trendy, it includes kombucha mixed with alcohol and other slightly healthy sounding mixed alcoholic drinks. They have a great Rose deal too on the weekends.  If you're NOT up for drinking, their food is great too. My favorite breakfast here is the sausage and sweet potato hash with jasmine blackberry tea to drink.  For lunch or dinner I recommend the option to make your own. I love the sustainable salmon, carrots, ferro mac and cheese, and broccolini.   Service here for the most part has been good, though it seems like the last time I came here the service wasn't as good, which is why I am giving 4 stars instead of 5. One waitress did not know what our appetizer was called and so we had some confusion on what dish was ours. We also experienced not having our water refilled throughout our meal. Not a huge deal, but still inconvenient when you're thirsty.   I'll still be back though, healthy food options are always great, and I really likely the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon toast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grapefruit brûlée

OLWK66Ug_iW1ZBcufXB8vA.text: Amazing!!  My husband and I decided to try this place out after we stumbled upon it from a walk we took while eaiting for a table at the Breakfast Club. I'm glad we did.   It's healthy, delicious and in good portions. This is my new favorite breakfast joint. I definitely will be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Flatbread. I wished the eggs were rather scrambled on top instead.
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein toast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein pancakes

t6KJ3aEFZ-IpkhWk1rRW4A.text: Food great (small portions tho), Atmosphere great, Service good, but prices little too high to eat there often.

ziUe8zYdYrb2NYtRQziugA.text: I come here at least 3 to 4 times a week. Saying I love this place would be an understatement. I love the friendly staff especially my girl Tia. This place is great for any occasion, post gym healthy dinner, a casual drink, or even a Sunday funday!!   My go to is the strawberry and goat salad, always a winner and Always and forever will be back!

UjWbjvjT3qMBm7egcxi7UA.text: This place has one of the best bartenders she super nice and really cool. Amazing menus and great flavors! Definitely recommend any of the kombucha cocktails. Awesome happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

leM4QA8lFdfDRWyvlk8VPw.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this trendy hip resto. Amazing cocktails very good food and great music in a location perfect for people watching. Outside tables are great when the weather is cooperative. Can't wait to go back!

9_HWwag3faLgykwfAy3gRg.text: Serious right now?  $6.00 for a regular large iced t?  You are OUT OF YOUR MIND.  Food, So So.  ordered the oatmeal to go, $6.00 in a tiny container and far too much Tureric.    I chose Chop Shop.  Prices are out to lunch here!!!!!

I7VoOdPkkg1UQMMqkNMpyg.text: Stopped here for drinks when we first got into town. The drinks are made from fresh ingredients & have healthy options like Kombucha shots. I will try one of those on the next trip but the cocktail with coconut water, blueberries, and vodka was amazingly refreshing. We sat at the bar which is inside and outside. It was a great way to start our spring training day out!

O79osz0dc7JpM4Ae2TuBHA.text: We are Canadian tourists and we wandered around to check out various food and drink venues and  we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and service mostly everywhere we went. But once we tried Farm and Craft for breakfast we knew we had found something special! The protein toast was amazing!  Then we came back several more times and each time the staff and service and food were superb!! Great vibe , very friendly staff and patrons ! By far the best of what Scottsdale has to offer and that says a lot! All the staff were great ! They are all very genuine and love what they do! Breakfast, lunch and dinner! And a special thank you to our dinner server Jackson  for his attentive, friendly and professional service and for making us feel so welcomed. Farm & Craft is a must if you like to eat (and yes even drink) heathy in an upbeat environment. Did we mention the food and service were fantastic?!

R8oMIA8rNS-wBSu89NWCiQ.text: Great place! Great brunch and coffee as well if you're looking for something quick and tasty. Service is prompt and friendly. I would come here before I went to the chop shop next door.

K-J1G3LMxrgMIEuZOlOgPQ.text: Really lives up to the name. This place is unique and unlike any other place. Really fun to just get a drink and hangout. Absolutely recommend.

3MJmyNJKDxEUY4kdDCWOSg.text: Krista was awesome! Great service and personable! Nachos were awesome! Fantastic beer selection!

43qRg0-5fa2mkUR-8CzyFg.text: Fantastically creative, yet simple menu with a very laid back, cool vibe (a tad hipster, but not in a cringeworthy way). Everything they brought to the table was so well crafted and presented, very tasty too. Big thumbs up for this joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meticulously crafted food and drink. Simple quality. Big thumbs up.

1cNjWyYrzDelmdDHKz_k1Q.text: Stopped here for a get together with friends from out of state. The location is great for the tourist crowd, setting is charming and the food was great. Everyone enjoyed their meal and drinks. I had the protein toast and would gladly order it again. To top it off, their servers were very friendly, patient and helpful. We need one in Gilbert!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein toast was delish and the dressing on the salad was perfect!

Z2mOc5cdHV9qUCP7hfd9ew.text: Hubby and I came for a date night meal.  The Blueberry Health Shot (martini) was spot on delicious!  We aplit the avacado hummus and lasagna bolegnase.  The hummus was very bland.  Not even much avacado flavor.  But the lasagna was AWESOME.  So good it made up for the boring hummus!!  Rich flavor, perfect spice blends, just superb!!

Np0gVA3muGlks3czuY5KAA.text: The great service and delicious and healthy food have kept me coming back.  love the cocktails too! Love everything about this place... from the kombucha on tap, to the fun decor. Def check this place out :)

vlIMFRiMVWL_lur0vGWDzw.text: Had a bad morning the other day and decided I needed a bloody mary and decent breakfast.  Weather was nice and I ran across Farm & Craft.  Decor....very hip and fresh.  Big doors and windows open bring the outside in very nicely. Absolutely no complaints about the building.  The food and drink wasn't bad, but wasn't great.  The eggs were overdone. The bloody mary wasn't what you expect in the age of "who can make the best bloody."  Again.....not terrible.  Just not memorable.  You really need memorable smack dab in the middle of Old Town.

lsiuNkVIX4x5FfwdYRZDWw.text: Simply Gorgeous food, bright+ healthy and super friendly- smiles all around This is the perfect spot for healthy and super creative, feel-good cuisine  Seems more like a daytime place to me but they have reverse happy hour and I just discovered 7% cash back- how smart is that?  Be a little naughty and treat yourself to a koombucha cocktail and flax dough flatbread.  I seriously love this place and would eat here everyday  Please open one on Colorado like tomorrow!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. koombucha+tequila=

YKSrDceG95M6v3KQUI7WBQ.text: I had the make your own, steak, Mac and cheese, and bacon Brussels sprouts... All 3 were great! The lady that took my order was super friendly and nice, and food came out prompt. The atmosphere is adorable, love it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nirGCPG5Cu_zZTxpemhrnw.text: I've had my eye on Farm & Craft since before they opened, but I just got the chance to give it a try for brunch this morning! Everything was fresh, and the vibes are adorable as can be! I ordered the American Breakfast - complete with scrambled egg whites, sweet potato hash, and chicken sausage. I was really impressed with the plate, and felt like the price was right for this area and the portion size. My friends and I also split the protein pancakes... YUM, they were sooo delicious - I would definitely recommend these! Not sure how healthy they could actually be, but it was the perfect sweet treat to top off our meal!  Aside from the vibes and tasty food, our server lacked in helpfulness and enthusiasm. As first timers, we hoped for better guidance on the menu and questions that we had. In addition to this, she wasn't very friendly in the slightest about it all. Regardless, I'll be back! But at a hip and trendy place like this, that has everything going for them, I hope this is one area they improve upon!

VsOefygod912q3plCnCilQ.text: One of my favorite places, a must first stop every time I land here, great atmosphere, food is terrific and overall a fantastic vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZsX8gsD6uSCzZ_UItiOWdg.text: I came here for the kombucha and rum! Lol saw the reviews and the menu and I love kombucha and I enjoy rum, so when I saw that they mix both here I knew I needed to try this.  The food tasted so fresh but then again I'm starting to think the Arizona Restaurants buy nothing but fresh produce! Good job!  I had sweet potato with eggs and applewood chicken sausage. I loved the applewood chicken sausage! I sat at the bar and the bartender was nice and attentive but just wished they were more friendly. No complaints, they did a good job. I'm just use to bartenders sparking conversations with me. However the area is beautiful, the food was great, the service was quick so overall I will be back! Soon...

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zTH-eeR-zvqxofk0JykpQA.text: This place has a fun atmosphere with great appetizers and drinks. Small but amazing patio space and cute for photos.

M1kq54ibpGVSE8xuhDZJ6w.text: I'm really disappointed in the lack of service I experience this morning. I have heard so many great things about this place and was looking forward to trying it for awhile now.  We arrived at 9:45am and got seated on the patio right away. There was a few other tables on the patio as well which is why I don't understand how we were completely ignored by the wait staff walking by. After 15 minutes, we watched 2 other tables get sat and greeted by their server right away. The hostess and 2 other servers even looked right at us sitting there with our menus but didn't seem to care to ask us if we had been helped yet.   We decided to leave since we didn't have time to continue waiting. When we approached the gentleman at the front who seated us (possibly a manager?), we expressed our disappointment and told him we were never greeted even after the 2 tables who sat down after us were assisted right away. He apologized but that was about it.   I'd like to give this place a second chance, but I feel like the lack of concern and customer service has already proven that it may not be worth it.

kRyitA17pIARmEoeXLCh7A.text: My girlfriend and I went to Farm & Craft on Saturday 2/24/18. The place was busy (it was brunch time), and we had to wait about a half hour for a table; they have a text system that alerts you when your table is ready which was very nice because it allowed us to walk around and look in the stores in the surrounding area. I got a hipster-ish yet casual vibe from this place. There were tables outside and a comfortable amount of space between tables inside the restaurant.   Once we were seated, we were waited on by a very friendly and enthusiastic staff. The menu had plenty of options, all of which were highlighted by various health-oriented aspects. The options were extensive enough to provided unique dishes without being repetitive but not so widespread that it was overwhelming.   They had a wide range of beverages and cocktails that included house juiced concoctions, kombucha on tap, a typical range of bistro coffees, and an exceptional list of cocktails. I had originally intended to get kombucha, but my attention was diverted by a drink with my namesake (the Patrick); so, I tried that instead. The Patrick was a blend of pineapple juice, cantaloupe juice, lime juice, and jalapenos. Despite the jalapenos, the drink was not spicy, but the flavor was prevalent and nicely balanced the sweetness of the other juices.  For my entre, I order the salmon toast which was assembled with smoked salmon, tzatziki, watercress, and cherry tomato on top of flax whole wheat toast that I would guess was made in house; it was delicious and appropriately portioned so as not to fill me up but left me satisfied. All the flavors melded well; between the smokiness of the salmon and the subtle creamy, cool, tanginess of the tzatziki was applied in the perfect amount not to overpower the other flavors, the sweet cherry tomatoes had a wonderfully light taste to them that is often absent in supermarket tomatoes, and the flax seed toast added a wonderful grainy and savory flavor bringing the entire dish together. I also ordered their sweet potato hash which wasn't anything special, it consisted of diced sweet potatoes and caramelized onions, but still good.  My total bill was $14 not including tip, which I believe was a good value and reasonably priced for an ethically produced healthy meal. I would recommend going here.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon toast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon toast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon toast

dFZbYk2DWWcgS9rdltMojA.text: Concept here is farm to table and they did it perfectly. Interior and decor is modern and inviting. It's a very health conscious menu with many different ingredients and ideas. The staff was attentive and helpful. My friend and I both enjoyed our meals here. My only suggestion would be to give more steak in the steak bowl. Everything was fantastic, but I feel like I barely had any steak.

drkZOggr8gmYQKNtgdXhjA.text: We ordered take out from Farm &  craft during a team planning summit. I spent quite a bit of time perusing the menu and looking at Yelp photos and based on what I read and saw my breakfast was just as expected! It was tasty and healthy and it was still warm! I'd definitely come back in for a healthy breakfast as a dine in customer.

IhtRRl9XVOdlaydIEthUvQ.text: This is really between 3 & 4 stars for me, but ultimately it's the food/menu that counts (which is the part I really liked), so I'll go on the higher side :)  For whatever reason I've avoided this place since it opened, but a friend wanted to go here for lunch recently so I said sure why not. It reminds me a lot of Flower Child menu-wise (which is another restaurant I didn't think I'd like until I ultimately tried it). There's a healthy mix of sandwiches/salads/wraps. They also do a thing where you can pick a protein (or tofu) and however many sides you want at $4 each. This is the option a went with (tofu + two sides).  As far as the restaurant itself it's nice. The dining room is big, and they have a bar (which I appreciate) as well as a nice patio. My one complaint is no matter where you sit it's LOUD.   My friend and I were confused when we walked in. We were waiting on someone else, but wanted to order a drink while we waited. At Farm & Craft you order food from a counter. The hostess told us if we were only drinking order from the bar, but if we were getting food...even if we were waiting to do so until our other friend arrived order at the counter. Don't really see the difference, but sure.   What made things even a little more confusing is that once our friend arrived (and the place got a little busier) a waitress came to our table as we were getting up to order at the counter (?).  That all being said, once you get past the whole confusing set-up/ordering process the food & drink are good!  For one, this place does Happy Hour (2-6). I forget what the beer is called they have on HH, but it's good and it's only $3. We also ordered the spinach dip, which was $5 during HH and it was delicious. It came w/carrots & healthy-ish crackers that were good.   Like I mentioned earlier I did the tofu + sides. The tofu was good, although I wish it would have been a little warmer. The bacon brussel sprouts were delicious and I LOVED the farro & cheese! It was rich, and cheesy and the farro was a very good substitute for pasta. The portions were not huge, but were definitely fair for the price.   I'd come back here during HH for sure.

Ye88rP4DRTjPRYRkz4NaAw.text: I got the BBQ pizza and I loooove it! I crave it occasionally but it's just far from my location. Any time I'm in the area, I always stop by for their yummy food

-S7WPOJBVptk7P0NQJ-GyA.text: I was thrilled to stumble upon Farm & Craft after arriving in Scottsdale. One look at the menu and I knew there would be plenty of options to accommodate my Whole30 diet. I ordered the salmon dish with sides of sweet potatoes and garlic spinach. I loved the varied unsweetened iced tea options and helped myself to one of the unique flavors before parking myself at a table next to an outlet to charge my phone.   Food is cooked to order so there was a short wait time, but totally worth it! My dish was incredible and probably my favorite thing I ate in Scottsdale all week. My only regret is that I didn't have an opportunity to return. Great spot for healthy people who love food.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole30-friendly eats yasss!

tsRq6ANd2edSGCJLaJICDQ.text: Great food every time  And great choices I love the salmon bowl with a couple other possibilities such as the beets They are delicious and my husband loves the sweet potatoes and then of course several of the salads are exceptional We usually find a place to sit but what we don't like is al the noise loud loud noise

iLk5aOwWf64KfCUo_SLL7g.text: Great food and one of the best decor I have seen in a restaurant! Let's just start with the decorations - amazing. I wish I could have my house look like this place and I fact I took a few pictures for inspiration. It is clean, unique and modern which makes for a great atmosphere when out for brunch or lunch!   The food here is wonderful. I went with my girlfriends and we all tried something different and nothing disappointed. The portions were perfect size so we didn't leave food on our plate it needed a to go box. It was great flavors and didn't leave you feeling heavy or gross. The clean ingredients make for delicious eats!   The only thing holding me back from 5 stars was the very very very long wait for the food and lack of servers. Our server was wonderful but he was running around and didn't have time to fill up our waters or get us a second drink.    If you have time to kill and want good food stop in here! iQAcdBjGqHM8QG4-v3HBGA.text: If you want a place with healthy food options, inviting decor, and a solid selection of adult beverages, this is the place!   There's outdoor seating, bar seating, and indoor table seating. We sat outside and it was very nice, although we did move once since we began to get pretty hot from the sun. The environment is casual and rustic. I love how the interior is decorated!   I enjoyed a couple of glasses of rose ($9 each) and I saw several people with unique drinks that were served in watermelon halves and oranges. When I return, I'll have to try one of these.   For food, we had the avocado hummus. Nice healthy option. The pita bread was warm and the hummus was unique! I followed that with the cashew chicken salad. It was huge and I had plenty left over to bring home. Overall, I really enjoyed the salad but I will say that I wish the dressing was a little more flavorful. That would be my only complaint. My mom has the quinoa Greek salad and she really liked it. The pieces of feta were huge and delicious!   The service was friendly and attentive. When I'm in the area, I'll definitely be back. I would love to check out their happy hour!

S33C96mcDyTORq9NlICwqA.text: Went here on a Thursday. Ended up being there for happy hour. Food was so so. Got the bbq chicken flat bread and avo hummus. XRFiPggxBBBTOlNQZP6Dpw.text: I had been to the Farm & Craft on 7th and absolutely loved it! This was my first time at the Scottsdale location.  I got an Avocado Hummus appetizer and was thoroughly impressed. I have celiacs and always have such a hard time finding gluten free options that taste good. Farm & Craft does not disappoint! I ordered the Wild Mushroom flatbread and I can honestly say I have never had a flatbread/pizza this amazing! In addition to the fact that it was Gluten free (with no upcharge!), the toppings were imppecable!  Everything was perfectly distributed with tons of mushrooms. Super flavorful without being overpowering. The service was great! (full water glass at all times which is something I truly appreciate). I will absolutely be returning and would 11/10 recommend, especially if you are gluten free! Well done Farm & Craft!

iLAu_skWbgLEdmnultFqyg.text: I came here for my Birthday. It was the perfect place to spend brunch. We ordered our food at the counter and took a seat in the spacious indoor dining area.   There was a bar inside and a beautiful patio outside. We opted to sit inside because it was a bit chilly outside. Within a very short time our food arrived. I had never ordered oatmeal when dining out, however, I wanted to stay within my diet and from the description: blueberry, apple and chia seeds, topped with golden milk; it sounded amazing. It was. It came in a small bowl and was just the right amount, and very filling. It was creamy and perfectly sweetened. There was turmeric mixed in to reduce inflammation - perfect during weightlifting and had apple squares on top.  Strawberries blueberries and almond milk smoothie is what I had for my drink along with a nice cup of coffee. The smoothie was refreshing and naturally sweet. I added in peptides for extra nutrients.   As a starter we got the avocado hummus which consisted of avocado, citrus vinaigrette, spices, served with a pita & broccoli and carrots.   The overall experience was a wonderful way to spend my birthday brunch! I think next time we will sit out on the patio. Hopefully it will be warmer!   They also have vegan ice cream which is rare to find. I ran out of room but next time I'll start with that first!

9gDSRCh8N68FR1OTjVFnIg.text: Had a really great lunch at Farm & Craft.  I am on a very restrictive health diet right now and the choices are limited for me.  They had items that perfectly fit the bill and were delicious too!  I had their RUSTIC SALMON BOWL with faroe island salmon, cauliflower, carrot, broccoli, brussels sprouts, quinoa, basil kale pesto & pepitas. The salmon was cooked perfectly as were the veggies.  Packed full of flavor served over quinoa that completed the meal.    Our server was very nice, but the service from the kitchen and juice bar was very slow. It is a Sunday and they were busy, but it was a bit uncomfortably slow.  Hence the missing star.  I would go back though at a less busy time.

PVrk63Niz3GfRaSQRv6e3Q.text: I've seen this place in old town and have always walked by and thought it was super cute. The aesthetic is definitely top-notch, but the food was disgusto barfo. Highly disappointed. I couldn't even finish my meal.   I ordered a BBQ pizza and understand it's supposed to be a healthy trendy spot with fresh ingredients...but oh my god. I couldn't finish three bites. It was disgusting and didn't taste anything like BBQ pizza. My whole table didn't enjoy their meal. A friend ordered the burger and it wasn't juicy and was super tiny. Another friend ordered the Chicken Melt and it was super average.   This place has tiny portions and not the most friendly service. Only thing that was decent was their lemonade.

qGQBMJhJZBHchcBth1fr_w.text: Just don't.  I would give this 1 and a half stars if they allowed because the service was acceptable but simply put, the food was barely palatable.  Farm & Craft bills itself as 'focused on healthy and sustainable food'. I'm sure the food is both healthy and sustainable but so are grass clippings.  It doesn't mean you want to eat them.   The restaurant is part of a trend that focuses more on dietary needs than flavor, texture or appearance.  You end up with bland food that only those with extreme dietary requirements would find acceptable.  If you read five star reviews, that's their target audience.  My wife is the person F&C was designed to serve. She is gluten free, does not eat fried food and her animal proteins are limited to the ocean.  She basically lives on veggies and loves them .  She ordered the Chilled Raw Pad Thai after the waiter indicated that it was one of his favorite menu items.    She was served a plate of raw spiralized zuchini with equal parts julienned carots and some bean sprouts.  She had it topped with some grilled tofu.  We both agreed that the Pad Thai flavor was sorely missing and that the only part of the dish with some value was the grilled tofu.  She compared the dish to one of those bagged salads you can buy at the supermarket.  She finished her dish because with her diet, she's learned to tolerate just about anything but she wouldn't return to F&C.   I ordered the Steak Wrap with a side salad.  First, what would you expect to be the primary ingredient in a steak wrap?  Steak, of course.  Unfortunately, F&C believes that adding a bunch of soggy baby bella mushrooms is an acceptable substitute for a reasonably amount of steak.  Hint, they're not!  The entire soggy mess was served in a whole grain tortilla that should have been first crisped a bit on a grill.  The pepper jack cheese had no flavor and there wasn't even a hint of the horseradish sauce.  If I have to add Sriracha to a wrap that has horseradish sauce,  we have a problem.  The sad thing was that the wrap wasn't the worst thing on the plate.  The 'side salad' was literally a few lettuce greens on the side of the plate that had been tossed with some utterly nondescript vinaigrette.  The entire dish was tasteless and boring.  Even the steak was boring as it hadn't been seasoned at all.  The bottom line is that regardless of dietary goals and mission statements, the first job of a restaurant is to serve food that tastes good.  It was completely possible to make both dishes we were served excellent.  Seasoning is not an enemy of the environment nor the digestive tract.  There has to be steak in a steak wrap. Pad Thai, regardless of the angle, should have some peanut flavor.  And a salad is more than some lettuce leaf.

Dt05Ymg7xL7qWbMS5FF4MA.text: I have recently taken on a vegetarian diet and I am still exploring vegetarian/vegan food and restaurants. My boyfriend surprised me with dinner here for my birthday and we both left very satisfied and ready to come back! He is not vegetarian, but he ordered the salmon and was very happy. I ordered the vegan flatbread. You definitely get a good amount of food with the flatbread. We also ordered the blueberry lavender ice cream and gluten-free brownie. Both very very delicious. For drinks, my boyfriend ordered the kombucha & habanero and I had the watermelon squeeze. Again, we were very satisfied! I highly recommend this place to any vegan, vegetarian, or anyone who enjoys good (and healthy) food! I cannot wait to come back and try more of the items on the menu.

cPnp7ka1qFONGO8OiiUnaA.text: Strolling around Old Town Scottsdale with my family, I spotted an adorable restaurant called Farm & Craft the first day of the visit. I said: "That looks so cute, let's go there on Sunday for brunch."  And so we Open-Tabled it up, and we got our brunch on. We sat on the patio with our dog, and the restaurant was super dog friendly. They even had a basket of toys and water bowls for dogs, and there was an entree you could order for your dog on the menu, which was neat.   I really liked the thoughtful healthy options on this menu. It was clearly identified for different dietary needs such as common ones like gluten-free and vegan. Farm & Craft takes this up a notch by offering unique designations like anti-inflammatory diet and reduce overall stress for their menu.   I enjoyed the mimosa and crustless quiche that I ordered. One of us had an "amazing" fresh bowl with salmon. I got a side of beets, and they were so good with a horseradish sauce. Another one of us had a "underwhelming" burrito.   We all agree our waitress was not super friendly and seemed like we annoyed her when we asked questions, but we know everyone has a bad day now and then. Overall, Farm & Craft was lovely, and we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menus and iced tea
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced tea and mimosa
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious bowl with salmon, mixed veggies, and beets.

0oS_S8F4dByguYDaSZQfeg.text: This is a very hip place located in downtown Scottsdale with a focus on fresh and local. I enjoyed the variety of items on the menu, including multiple vegan items that were clearly labeled.   Their cocktail menu is particularly unique with a variety of kombucha-based cocktails. Of particular enjoyment, though, was the incredibly fresh Paloma. They take a fresh grapefruit and hollow it out to make juice, then they mix the tequila with the juice, pour it back into the grapefruit, and serve it in the fruit with a straw! The presentation alone is worth it.  I had the probiotic bowl, which honestly sounded better than it tasted. It was served with mixed greens because of the romaine scare, and that might have been part of the problem, as the bitterness of the greens didn't work well with the dish. It was also not that filling - after 2 hours I was quite hungry again.  My husband did the vegan flatbread, which was the better option of the two. It was topped heavily with arugula, making for a nice presentation.  Our service was excellent. The server was kind, helpful, and patient. I wish I had gotten her name because she was the type that deserves a shout out by name.  All in all, I would return to try a few more items on the menu, especially the drink menu. They seem to have a good happy hour, so that might be the prime time to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing fresh Paloma - in the grapefruit!

ZxMCeM5zv5ESs7IEEG7B5A.text: Why have I waited so long to go to Farm & Craft??  There really is no good answer to that question, but I am so glad that I finally made it there!    The food, drinks, and service were all worthy of a five star review!   We started with the Avocado Hummus Appetizer (check out the Yelp check-in offer).  The veggies were fresh and the hummus was quite tasty!   For our meal, we ordered the Rustic Salmon Farm Bowl, the Flat-Iron Steak, and a side of Brussels sprouts (with bacon, walnuts, and cranberries).  The quinoa, salmon, and vegetables in the salmon bowl all complemented each other wonderfully!  The Brussels sprouts are recommended as well.  And the star of the night was the Flat-Iron Steak!  The included side is mashed potatoes, but they had run out of mashed potatoes, so we substituted a side of sweet potato hash... and the resulting combination of flavors was absolute perfection!  Loved this dish!  The only drink we ordered was The Hydrator.  I thought it was vibrant, refreshing, and interesting (in a good way)!  I don't recall the name of our server, but he had a handful of tables and was still very personable, quick to take our drink, appetizer, and meal orders, answer menu questions, and follow up with us!     *****FIVE STARS*****

Might come back here for lunch or dinner to try something different. The restaurant is very cute on the inside and I loved all the windows and the outdoor patio.

livFSQdG-BmrJ1AttyN6Yw.text: Long day golfing and water park. Finished with dinner here and absolutely loved it. Staff went out of the way to get us seated quickly and the food was AMAZING per our friends daughter. Loved it!

kt_VCA0MmudAKd8WyME1YQ.text: Great vegan choices but lots of other things too. Bowls are good; nice wines. A little too noisy for anyone without good hearing.

WwWEQIsswU9KAC96TatYaw.text: Farm craft is A very tasty healthy breakfast spot. I walked in and encountered some people from michigan and they greeted me as I walked in the door. They noticed I was wearing A lions shirt and hat and commented that they were from michigan as well. Then we were taken to our seats and given the menu of deliciousness. I tried the yogurt parfait A fresh pressed juice and for A big guy like me I ordered the breakfast burrito with avocado. The pressed juice made me feel great! The burrito was too delicious And had not a drop of grease! To me that is very impressive. The parfait was like no other left there eating some clean food that tasted bomb!

MNkyYmlB8vHZEpLzRuS-mA.text: I appreciate a restaurant doing something different. I liked how the items on their menu was marked as to which different diets they followed. Great idea and original. I did have an issue but Kevin was gracious enough to reach out. I did genuinely enjoy my meal and really appreciate someone bringing delicious, healthy, organic meals to the table. I look forward to going back and becoming a regular.

9p7UIzHpyBmT9r_d9tYgGw.text: If I could do a negative star I would. While I did not sit down and eat here, I stopped by and got a lemonade to go. 12 oz, they said they used honey instead of sugar as a sweetener so I was good with that. Guess how the drink cost me....$3...no.....$4....no......$5.49....yes. For LEMONADE!?  I asked the server why? They looked at me like I asked them who the president elect is. I am rarely critical of a restaurant, as I want to see Scottsdale's restaurants succeed. But, it seems like there are misguided greedy people in the business.  This place epitomizes the reputation Scottsdale has for being pretentious.   For now, I don't trust the team at F&C and won't eat there. They won't care though as they have enough customers (for now) to keep the lights on.  Vote with your dollar folks.

4oAwP7brlGw6HEC9hoqenQ.text: Great farm to table type food. Great place if you are in the mood for something healthy. The drinks are awesome because they have a healthy vibe. The decor is great. Good spot for a double date or if you have company in town or someone with specific food preferences. Fun vibe!

dduH7mAbQrC2bV_Arh5FYg.text: The food is always great here. From their protein pancakes to their steak sandwich, you really can't go wrong.  Before 3pm you order at the front desk, which as of late has lengthy wait times. After 3pm they offer table service which 10x faster.

5bHhHWi6OCpaT4w5yCY_eg.text: I really love this place!  I come here for brunch and evening cocktails!!  They have an amazing juice bar and healthier options for breakfast, which I love. They also have really creative cocktails. I have yet to be disappointed by any of them!  Cocktails with kombucha-say whaaaat?  YUM!!  The restaurant is not very big but I've never had to wait. They have a few tables of outdoor seating and heat lamps when appropriate. The staff has always been friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet potato hash w/chicken sausage!!  SO SO GOOD!!

wk027qJ_oAQuijJNz4bO0A.text: Was ordered this for pickup. I got the Cali Chicken Bowl which I loved. The chicken is very flavorful. He ordered the Tocoa Steak Bowl. I didn't like this one, the meat was way too bland. I will definitely be back for quick easy food.

CdRUEORMPSGtSFeov4idmQ.text: Interesting food. Healthy options but not your typical breakfast food menu. The protein pancakes were awesome!

zPlG4wgxS3aXvdTCjUwFuw.text: This place was super disappointing- went in for brunch on my birthday. Service was mediocre at best, indifferent and unfriendly. The worst was the food. I ate it because I was starving but it was barely warm and had no flavor. Eggs not cooked as order, breakfast potatoes and sausage limp. Also ordered the brioche which sounds amazing on the menu - its basically a slice of bread barely toasted on one side with some cold mascarpone cheese and strawberries on top. SO tasteless for such a supposedly nice combination of ingredients. Won't be going back or recommending to anyone.

Zg0D7k9tyk5zESz7VnZb3g.text: Good: kombucha cocktails.. happy hour prices $8, worth it. Otherwise $12 for 6oz  Needs improvement on time of order to eating, took over 45 mins and came as a carry out even though we ordered to eat here.    We ordered artichoke dip, ... skip it. It was luke warm and clotting cheese.  Chicken tacos were good but pretty spicy.   Would I go back- no.

oYr-gilj1hH6gOwDgr_ngw.text: Foods good. The atmosphere is fun. The bugs/flying nats, not so much fun. Makes me wonder why they are here and why so many. Too bad. Cute place.

guh8EU3Ay1JQyVAQ2hPC7Q.text: It has been a while since i dined in old town. During Sunday brunch hours, we were there debating where to eat and saw decent amount of people there so decided to take a chance.  Sat outside on a sunny day with mimosa and a pale ale with nice friendly staff. Had tuna pokey and hamburger.  Pokey was good but the winner was the burger. It was one of the best burgers we had. Highly recommend trying the burger!!! It was such a pleasant surprise and made our relaxing day a memorable time!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

c4oKHDrEmV9hz6DQCnYogA.text: My experience here was marvelous. I love the design of the menu and how it's sorted into the four different categories.   Our server was great and very knowledgeable of the menu. That always makes the experience more pleasant. I will definitely be coming back here for some more yummy Kombucha cocktails as well

ihwrjBFzjx8cYFrQlGZTCw.text: Had brunch here with a few girlfriends and we all loved it. Awesome service Greeted and seated very quickly, even had a manager come over and introduce herself and asked about our meals. Cocktails are a must try. Had the farm house flatbread, definitely recommend it.

D-1DOTblrnR-pHUcmdhy-A.text: I came here on a Sunday night with a friend last month.  The restaurant was about a third full. The restaurant decor fit the name of the restaurant perfectly.  We were greeted and seated very quickly.  The service was great until we paid the bill.  My friend just came back from hiking and was drinking lots of water.  The water glass went empty for about 10-15 minutes before it got refilled.  The biggest problem was the food.  Started off with the hummus.  I've never had hummus that ran thru the tines of the fork.  It was the consistency of a soup.  The flavor was even worst.  It had no flavor.  It tasted like mashed chickpeas mixed with water.  There was no tahini  flavor at all.  The pita bread that came with it tasted old.  They could have heated it up to freshen it up.  I had the Strawberry and Goat Cheese Salad.  It was a little small as other people stated, but I had a big lunch so it was the perfect size for me.  The problem was there was only two strawberries the size of grapes.  To make up for it I think they gave me LOTS of goat cheese.  I like goat cheese but it's really strong and you need to balance it with the rest of the ingredients.  My friend had the chicken and sweet potato hash  She liked the hash a lot, but the chicken was only okay. She recommended this restaurant and was kind of sorry we came here.  I only gave it two stars because it's all about the food.  The service and atmosphere are fine.  Maybe it was off night.  Even our company cafeteria makes better food considering the number of complaints they receive.

-Bci-U1clhL2Pfz1b4Hlyg.text: Do you like to be ignored and pretentiousness? This is definitely the place for you. Waited 5-10 minutes to be seated outside even though we could see multiple empty tables (the "Reserved" next to us was open before and after we left). We were finally seated and no one even acknowledged our existence for at least 10 minutes after which we left. No one could even recognize we were there. No water, no menus, no acknowledgement. Some of their menu items    "reduce stress". Seriously? Want to reduce a customer's stress? Pay attention to them! The place was not even that crowded on a Friday night...not surprising.

pqq0CRhnvlNGmAtiTKDXRw.text: It's as if things can't get better, but this was a much stronger time than I recall.  I brought my girlfriend and her sister-in-law here, you folks just killed it.  Our waitress navigated our meal perfectly providing insight into the drink and dinner menu.    Flat Iron Steak, and the Happy Apple Bourbon. Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flat Iron Steak

pPG5aiAcT2B7hzzsP73Rpw.text: We stopped in for breakfast while staying in Scottsdale. All the food on the menu looked great. I had the protein toast with salmon and egg whites, which was a perfect combination. Then had the pancakes which were both delicious and protein packed. My wife enjoyed her Breaky Burrito and finished it off with a tasty acai bowl. The location was great, the food was tasty and the service was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LaxBWFOKxkNi9Tdc0NEgPg.text: If you love healthy food this place is for you! Loved it - came here for dinner and sat outside. The service could have been better, but overall a great place.

jqtQsQIj70l-Xns2gciJ3Q.text: Loved the delicious field green salad with walnuts and strawberries, I added chicken and it was perfect, also ordered a hamburger and it was the best I've had in Phoenix, not sure what makes it different but don't change!

GpZ_pnrhXcZ7f8-72eRBww.text: Great food. This place was PACKED which usually means good things. The service was also excellent. I loved the variety of food choices. They have an outside patio and you can bring your dog, too. I didn't, but it was good to know.

mFsAd5lC8O8poqlAm6oRZA.text: This is what we were told verbatim from bartender  I am too busy right now to serve you and your two friends a mimosa. It was getting crowded around the bar  Wow!!! That is mind blowing since it is a restaurant with a bar. The hostess ended up getting us mimosa order.

1ZrZnX8UFIIW60QnfDV2zw.text: Great place for a quick and healthy meal. They had a decent array of gluten-free and vegan options. I opted for a mixed veggie plate with a side of quinoa salad and it was tasty. Not mind-blowing, but I was happy to have spent my money here vs somewhere else. The coffee was good as well, and kombucha on tap! Nice touch.

_0Msrh746F2aw8BMXxUZlQ.text: I use to work near by and my favorite morning order was the avocado toast and Kombucha.

EYDt378HMmL0jefborlYhg.text: Great food and wonderful management  Service started out bad and management rose to the occasion and did not charge us for our meal. Exceeded my expectations but I would return with no reservations .. def give this place a shot.

8VhJzgTr92_CAGXygHJNrg.text: I met a friend up for Sunday brunch at noon - thankfully we made reservations in advance because it was pretty busy. The food was delicious! I ordered a coffee, which had really great flavor and their protein pancakes. I would not have guessed those pancakes were protein if I had not know. They had berries inside the cake and were topped with granola and pieces of strawberries. They are 2 medium sized cakes and not much of the agave is needed as the granola and berries add so much flavor. My friend is vegan and ordered the vegan Tofu sandwich. The server said the portion was a good size for one person but she was only able to eat half. Her sandwich also came with a side salad.   I definitely recommend making reservations if going for brunch and don't waste time circling looking for street parking. Just go to the parking garage located on 5th ave.

GIVziWr1pZlwtLHIJOg9bg.text: I think I love the concept of Farm & Craft more than I actually like Farm & Craft.  It gives off such healthy, fresh, simple vibes that I really appreciate and our avocado lime hummus starter was great but I wish the Rustic Farm Salmon Bowl had been way more flavorful.  It needed a sauce and a lot more salt and pepper.  The salmon itself was wonderful but everything else just fell a bit flat.  I did really like my kombucha cocktail though!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IQ2kdyZRskNEaq3vM9vYjw.text: Excellent!! Healthy!! We had breakfast and dinner at Farm and Craft. Both meals were delicious! Best food in Old Town.

4ZWgRElvdwIf-XzJxlxW3A.text: Veggies were enough to fill one taco, and they were smothered in oil. The tacos were hard and not good. Definitely do not recommend eating here. Only thing that was good was the guac

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zOy4EcH-Tpj59wvRGp1mQw.text: We stopped here spontaneously on a beautiful April day after a hike. We sat outside and it was gorgeous in the shady patio. Wonderful healthy options that were delicious too. I had the protein pancakes and they were delightful with the agave maple syrup. The kids loved their breaky burrito and American breakfasts. Hubby had the salmon toast and gobbled it away. We are all leaving very satisfied but don't feel overstuffed and gross. The service was chill and excellent, nothing but good things to say, we will be back!

0sLB7Ao1TYhTssd49d0IEg.text: Understaffed on a Thursday night. Food was extremely slow to get to our table, and everything seemed either over cooked or stale. Mac and cheese was a bit hard. Brussel sprouts were also tough. I got 3 pieces of well done steak in my steak bowl. Not the best experience for a $50 meal. Cool concept, horrible execution! "All I wanted was good food and perfection" (their slogan) and all I got was nothing in return!

cJ4bRV93svkve7dFhFlYkA.text: Oh this was absolutely delicious! Loved the selection, and the food and beverages themselves were awesome.

Cet65-fNMZw-KO59GMaArg.text: Popped by for breakfast and sat at the counter. Lovely bar staff. Had the crustless quiche which was good if not outstanding.

TAaNU95oWzu5EWDGGQIHbw.text: Farm and craft was the perfect place for my annual New year resolution, eating clean. Parking can be a little annoying but if your patient you might get a spot near by.   I just happen to make my first visit on Thursday night. Thursday they have flatbread and a bottle of wine for $20.  I would of loved to have ordered it if I didn't commit to not drinking while on trek to clean eating.  Walking in it was pretty busy with no open tables besides the bar or patio. Luckily they have heaters from top to bottom on the patio which is perfect for me.   Service was a little slow to start off and I could hear the waiter Tell the tables in front and behind me apologizing for the wait and that the kitchen was backed up. So I kinda gave the waiter some slack and maybe it was the $20 Thursday rush.   Right after he let the other tables know about the food he finally noticed our table. We ordered Kombutcha with Rum and Kombutcha with Bourbon. Definitely recommend the Kombutcha with Bourbon it was delicious!  For my main dish I ordered chicken Farro Mac & Cheese which was pretty good. But sadly my chicken was so dry it was tough to chew and I couldn't even cut threw it.  I feared sending it back to the kitchen having to wait another 30 mins.  One dish I really enjoyed and could eat over and over again was the avocado hummus! It was the appetizer and I should of just ordered that for dinner that would of satisfied my palette.   For dessert I ordered the Paleo brownies with a scoop of ice cream. It was the perfect ending to dinner, but beware it's not your usual brownie! So if your in for a sweet treat this may not be your choice, but I loved it.   Maybe next time service will be better and my chicken will not be so dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AbR2PR1UGntn-pZz92gbbQ.text: We arrived at the perfect time for breakfast Sunday morning - right around 1015am.   Short wait - around 15 minutes.  We hear the wait times get up to an hour and a half, so we consider ourselves lucky.   The menu isn't huge but the options are all amazing.   We ordered Salmon Toast with egg whites and Protein Pancakes.  Both were delicious.   If you're in Scottsdale for the weekend - this place is not to be missed.

iqZK8luYPStxAMW8yC6YIQ.text: Tried this restaurant out on a trip to AZ. It was quite busy but the staff was hustling around clearing tables and bringing out orders promptly. There is outside seating which is great and a large portion of the side wall  opens up the restaurant to fresh air outside. The food options were good with healthy ingredients. However I was very disappointed to find out they use vegetable oil for cooking. I realize it is cheaper however it is not healthy for us or the environment. I would definitely go back again when visiting.

yj5NZJDfEkXr7-ak6Q0utw.text: 9/8/19: We walked in for breakfast after a search on yelp for old town Scottsdale. The place is beautiful, really impressive when you walk in. It's all in the decoration and details. We are seated by the hostess and served. The free check in offer of hummus with veggies and flatbread is a must have! Delicious! I order the veggie bowl and he gets the American breakfast. It comes out very quickly. Large portions and really good. If I didn't have so many plans today I'd have tried one of their "healthy" drinks as that menu looked so good! Overall everything I like, if I lived around here I'd be a regular! I recommend this place! Trendy, delicious and healthy!  9/9/19: This place needs to open a location in Las Vegas asap! The food is AMAZING. I came back for lunch the day after I had breakfast here during my vacation stay in Phoenix. This time I had the salmon poke bowl and the carrot cleanse juice. Both were so good, I finished my bowl up to the last quinoa grain. It looks and tastes exquisite. The juice was a perfect mix of carrot and citrus, no overly dominant flavors. This time I sat outside and it was very relaxing. Soft pillows on the couches, music and sprinklers keeping you cool. Unfortunately I am going back home, if only I could take this place with me! I want to try every single item of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

lDO3O_NfPudUp95DHdm42g.text: 1 star for food and drinks actually being good. Minus 4 for everything else.   We came here with a bachelorette group of 15, and me being the bride to be had to apologize to my group several times for this restaurants lack of hospitality, service and slowness. We reserved months ahead, only to find out our table was not ready. After switching tables from inside to outside, we started ordering drinks which arrived 0.48 minutes later followed by apps after 1 hour followed by our entrees probably close to another hour. At least give the bride to be her drink....?   Anyways, the level of service we received from this place was just pathetic. We watched several nearby tables who arrived after us and received their meal and drinks right away which made us question a lot of things.  Bottom line, do not come here with a large group, they will not be able to accommodate you and you will have a poor overall experience which will ruin your day.   Advice to owner: Don't take reservations for large groups if you can't accommodate them in a timely manner.   Lastly, we had an amazing experience at each and every restaurant we went as a large group; except for this one.

o8vfDphXCC4epYF1ZKmFfQ.text: We decided to throw bachelorette party in Scottsdale ,Arizona .we had made reservations month ahead of time at this place for a party of 15 and yet when we got there somehow the table wasn't ready and we were told to wait 15 minutes . What was the point of making reservations for big group , right ? We let it slide .   We sat outside , all 15 girls  and I could see we did not blend in as a Minority  and " women of color" and from that point on , everything went downhill . Our waitress didn't seem  too pleased to serve us and seem so bothered by us , it took hour to get our drinks ( I understand it was a big group ) so we all decided to to be patient and just chitchat until the drinks were served . Let's talk about horrible customer service and how the food got served and how some of us never received the things we ask for such as spoon and silverware. Two hour  brunch turned into five hour disaster because it took them hour to serve drinks , other hour to serve our food and end of the day horrible CUSTOMER SERVICE . I would never go back to this place nor I recommend any other person of color to this restaurant because this place seems to serve well only to Caucasians .   Stay tuned for more reviews coming from 14 bridesmaids , who felt the same way .

ImJnGxUbyDeJW_ewYI2USQ.text: This was one of my favorite stops on our recent trip to Arizona. It's a very trendy place with great decor and overall feel. We were greeted and seated right away. The waiter was friendly and patient with us as we studied the menu. My boyfriend and I both chose to get a salad. I got the Strawberry and Goat salad. It was great... not overly saturated with dressing and had plenty of yummy, fresh strawberries. My boyfriend loved his salad as well! The avocado hummus came to us free with a Check-In here on Yelp. It, too, was delicious and I would highly recommend you order this (with or without the Check-In offer... it's worth it!) as an appetizer. When I am back in town this will definitely be on my list of places to revisit!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado Hummus
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry and Goat Salad
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Y3E6HwtSYN-hzGKaLfSsFg.text: This was a perfect spot for our group of girls wanting to eat healthy, have a latte & a cocktail. Juan was our server and he took great care of us and we were thankful he split the checks up individually for us. I had the breaky burrito which was yummy which big chunks of avocado. I also had a few bites of the protein pancakes which were delicious. This is centrally located to all the good stuff in Scottsdale and would definitely recommend anyone check it out. The decor is beautiful inside and the bathroom is so cute.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love a good bathroom
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ywfIS8D6M6xgkFlquhiMZg.text: Love the vibe! At first, all the menu seemed daunting. Did I want a meal to reduce my stress?? These days, let's be honest, we should ALL want that quality in a meal. The grilled salmon with pea puree, quinoa, and zucchini spirals was so flavorful that I forgot how zen it was advertised to be! The hydrator cocktail tastes like an Anthropologie store smells, but I still enjoyed both it - twice. Definitely recommend this place. Don't be scared off by the Whole Foods natural deodorant vibes - it puts just as much emphasis on taste as it does on health-centric living & community!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

aW735dogIebw714wkUpipQ.text: I don't realize this was a health conscious place until I arrived and looked at the menu. I wasn't sure what to order since I was in the mood for some fatty, sweet, and salty brunch food. I ended ordering three items and they were all absolutely amazing. I was shocked by how great everything tasted. I got the grass fed burger and it was super juicy and flavorful. The avocado hummus was simple and was a great appetizer. My girlfriend ordered the rustic salmon bowl and she was really happy with it (picky eater). Overall, I'd recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grass-Fed Burger, Avocado Hummus, and Rustic Salmon Bowl

NQk5ayL3NHdpaXAw5J-yjA.text: Caleb was our waiter and he was amazing. I loved his attitude and he was so kind . the strawberry health shots was delicious . Not so crazy on champagne strawberry but it was good . If you check in on yelp you get delicious avocado hummus. The place is cute

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jP4nYILHC4dyREPKBHtZFg.text: Was exploring downtown Scottsdale and was looking for a place to eat dinner. Saw the sign for happy hour from 4-6pm and just made it with 10 mins left to order happy hour food yay! $5 each for 4 dishes - bbq chicken flat bread and 2 apps (avocado hummus & vegan ceviche).  Servers were friendly and available when needed. Vibe was good - had background music in the background but it wasn't too loud and can still hear your nearby conversations. Decor was interesting. Lots of people were there during happy hour time.

Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mXe5p0odegZXiL20Z-0qpQ.text: It's a great place! Vegitarian?? Great, they'll meet you. There? .eat eater??  They'll meet you there! With such great and fast service too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. He&#39;s the best, and this place....well it&#39;s also the best.

nUVVPqnFNmcRKE5nMzBaOQ.text: Great service, beautiful ambience and healthy, tasty food! Hubs and I got a free avocado hummus app with yelp check-in (yummm), sausage & mushroom flatbread, and a sweet potato with organic tofu bowl.  Generous amount of food and all tasted fresh and guilt-free.  I also got a matcha mule which was super refreshing (non-alcoholic) while he got a watermelon passion cocktail.  Drinks were both delicious and not overly sweet which we prefer. Positive first impression of Scottsdale by stopping in here!
