Lq0uWIS-bAkumvPlFF3Lqg.text: Service was super slow. It only picked up after complaining service, we waited over 20 minutes and no drinks were offered until flagging someone over.   Now let's talk food: I would give this a 3.5/5 the check in appetiser was decent. However overall the food was not mouthwatering for the price. Yeah I get that it's organic but no True flavour.   So due to lack of service and the lack lustre in the food, we probably won't be back.

KqG5WnffG-K1hGnblpNcCw.text: Farm and Craft was good but I've had much better.  I always get a salad wherever I eat out.  My salad gave me the impression that it had sand in it, very gritty.  My husband had a wonderful chicken sandwich which he enjoyed very much.  We sat at the bar, at first bartender was awful but became more attentive after a while ( we were his only customers).  Overall I would not go back, too many restaurants in Scottsdale rated better.

ih3I0NwQ67MK7fFfO8D-jA.text: It's ironic that, in a restaurant that features a wide variety of non-vegan and vegan menu items, the best thing I ate was the Vegan Nachos. The, what I would assume, house-made tomatillo salsa was great. The vegan cheese was more than acceptable. Frankly, the only thing I would change with the dish would be to use normal tortilla chips. The Quinoa and Flax chips are barely a poor substitute for a corn tortilla chip. And, by using a corn tortilla chip, it might enable the kitchen to actually heat up the dish enough to melt more of the cheese. The melted vegan cheese is tasty. The unmelted vegan cheese leaves a bit of an aftertaste in your mouth. My daughter ordered the Vegan Flatbread and was amazed at how fresh and delicious the tomato on the flatbread, in combination with the olives, tasted.   I ordered the Flank Steak, a local, grass-fed steak served sliced with cheddar cauliflower mash, tomato confit & chimichurri. Frankly, even the chimichurri sauce wasn't enough to save me from just how boring and tasteless this particular steak was to me. It was cooked to order, medium rare. The color was perfect. I was just tasteless. I finally ordered some of the tomatillo salsa to drown it in anything that tasted of something.  The Cauliflower Mash was fine. I also ordered the side of brussels sprouts. I ordered it cooked well done, because, in my experience, very few restaurants actually seem to cook the glorious brussels sprout correctly so that they come out tender, and actually cooked. Most seem to just toss them in a pan for 2 minutes and call it a day. Frankly, if they would just steam them until 3/4 done, it would completely ramp up the dish in every restaurant that offers grilled or roasted brussels sprouts. So, back to Farm and Craft's version. It sucked. Dry, hard, not just hard from undercooking, but some were hard from overcooking. Also, has anyone in the kitchen heard of salt? How a dish made with bacon, cranberries and walnuts could taste on none of these ingredients is a testament to the kitchen. Any one of those ingredients could lead the show. All three should be able to hit it out of the park. This was a strike and a miss.   One last annoyance. I ordered a drink from the bar, an Old Forrester on the rocks. If you are familiar with the bourbon bottom shelf of most liquor stores, then you will recognize this brand. For the uninitiated, it's a $14 bottle of bourbon that plays well above it's weight class. As has become typical these days, F&C charges, on their menu, $10 for this particular bourbon. When I get my bill, I'm charged an extra $3 for "rocks". This immediately, after the less than stellar dinner, infuriates me. I really don't understand the theory behind this charge. If customers are pissed because you are such a tight wad restaurant that the drink looks too small in your bar glassware, perhaps you should get different glassware. It's one thing to measure out a 25 year old Macallan that costs more than $1800 a bottle, it's quite another to charge $13 for less than $1.50 worth of bourbon. It's insulting, and had lead me to order water most of the time when I go out for meals or drinks.   So, if I ever go back, I'll stick to the vegan nachos, the vegan flat bread, and water.

kjzxy6PRkaM3f_Sy3Ws_Lw.text: Went during the happy and healthy hour! Met a friend and sat on the patio to people watch. She tried the happy hour beer and got a kombucha cocktail. I stuck with the happy hour rose'. We shared 2 appetizers and an entree. Very healthy, very tasty. The vegan ceviche has some vinaigrette dressing that made you want to eat more. The raw pad Thai was pretty good. Tasted good and had a good crunch.  Avocado hummus is as tasty as it sounds. Would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hummus and pita bread
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chilled raw pad thai
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegan ceviche

UYsuc1bo5Qu3x8EjBjZcSQ.text: This place would be a 5-star if the food was most flavorful and/or was most cost-effective. I personally appreciate the quality of food offered at F&C.

cXEirZkd_LvullzMcmWa9g.text: We really enjoyed this place and plan for it to be one of our go-to places for keto-friendly brunch. We ordered the avocado hummus, crustless quiche, and a protein bowl - all of which were fantastic.  The service was a little slow at times, but this place was hoppin', so I don't blame them for the lull in response. We also ordered a drink that came out as a grapefruit-filled with Tito's and a cranberry ice cube mimosa. No fillers, no b.s. Just good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

INEj5j71hk5vhRsDCcGHUA.text: Love the concept here: healthy & fresh! I picked the make your own bowl and got chicken, broccoli & white cheddar mashed cauliflower! It was delicious- also tried the kombucha habanero cocktail. It was refreshing but I wished it would have been a bit more bubbly. Worth checking this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8tY4SjAv4wkpsw0_YB4d4A.text: Love everything about this place. The atmosphere is super fun, the staff is great and the food is delish!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ummmm yum!!!!!!!!
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing!

BuJsqG7STTlimGxHVsp4zA.text: Healthy, clean, and simple food. Bacon Brussels sprout flatbread was exactly what you would expect. It's lighter than flatbreads you would have at other restaurants. Chilled raw pad thai was more interesting. The texture of the vegetable noodle was good and the pad thai sauce had more citrus flavor. Lavender lemonade was really good with a hint of lavender flavor. Lemonade was not too sweet.   The only downside is that we went there for dinner. It seems like they have more variety of menu options for breakfast&brunch (which makes sense since the food is light and healthy).

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon Brussel sprouts flatbread and chilled raw pad thai salad with tofu

W5Xu_I0QxZ_js9mc1JJVnw.text: Great food! Bit on the pricey but worth every penny! I will definitely be back. Staff was great as well!

Df9dhjQbWCKwNMIkhoB8mg.text: This place was amazing! Healthy and great tasting food. They also have a pet friendly patio so it was great for us. The breakfast bowl had perfectly pouch eggs with quinoa, veggies and a delicious sauce! Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon toast
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hummus
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast bowl

fWqNh-kuMeHxYuXtY9y9HQ.text: salads are decent. I think some of the health factor is a little bit wrong, but the ingredients seem to be pretty fresh and the food is consistent.

EkFIDqwUtnzwYlYxtSQSMA.text: I love the concept of this place. Quite trendy, chic, and modern. Nice atmosphere, cute decor and set-up. A tad crowded though -- although crowded is a good thing when you have a business; it means your place is poppin'!   Started off our Friday night of shenanigans with a few close friends at the bar. Wasn't insanely busy, but definitely picked up as the night went on. Our bartender was super sweet and informative about their menu, drinks, etc. and was able to recommend drinks off the menu. I took his word for it and ordered the Wellness Martini. It was meh -- tasted more like a smoothie than a martini, and took quite a long time to get.   One of my friends ordered just tequila, lime, with a splash of grapefruit juice -- her signature drink... with NO simple syrup or agave, EVER! but the bartender snuck some agave in there... really, dude? Who does that? A girl knows what she wants; don't ever mess up a girl's chi with her drink. We saw him do it and then he wouldn't even admit to it, but he did remake it -- the way my friend ordered it from the get-go. (Not sure why guys don't like to listen???)   I know this place just opened so I'm still giving it 4-stars; it definitely has potential, but there are some "kinks" that need to be worked out for sure. And perhaps speed up the drink service? I know they're made fresh and "with love", but I was getting antsy waiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Wellness Martini
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Isn&#39;t this what we all want?!

Zx8J6PBCgRy6xjZW2beR_g.text: Fantastic service, all of the food we saw looked unbelievable, cocktails were outstanding!! My husband and I shared the Chicken Fried Rice (I wasn't super hungry) but it was some of the best I've ever had. They are extremely cognizant of food allergies, but that doesn't take away from the quality and taste of the food. I wish we had one of these back in Charlotte, NC!! Amazing decor and overall great vibes. Highly recommend!!!!

4ICpvoAW_j6dtbTEdS6NDg.text: First experience at Farm & Craft was a bust on Sat, Sept 1. Confirmed brunch reservation for a group of 13 celebrating a special occasion was not communicated to the restaurant by its own staff. While our group waited 20+ minutes for other tables at management's request ~  1. We were not offered the large table that was ready because they were holding it for another group our size that was coming in after us. Farm & Craft could've seated us promptly and offered the later group the tables they were pulling together for us that would be ready "soon". 2. Other tables right next to each other became available. Farm & Craft could've seated us promptly and pulled together several tables together.  Instead people that arrived after us were seated. 3. We were not offered a beverage or anything at all during our wait.  Subpar customer service, to be honest.  We took our business to the brewery across the street. That was a good call.

q3QNG2NPBrSqUwcvsOUJ3g.text: The food and service was amazing. The avocado hummus had the perfect avo taste and the cauliflower was such a nice additions instead of celery! I got the raw pad Thai it is the most perfect summer salad. Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!

xHI_rGpIZWxFMuWO0hejNw.text: I ordered the chocolate coconut smoothie -forget the actual menu name- but it is delicious! I've been here a few times and it is always good. Thank you.

LCrtIX_sGUZUYF1OIQLoTg.text: My expectations were pretty high for this restaurant.  Had such a cool ambiance!  We tried them for a late lunch and left so disappointed. I ordered the humus plate as an appetizer, which was fine.  My problem was my main entree. I put together my own dish.  I had the steak with the brussel sprouts.  Neither had any real flavor.  I asked for my steak to be medium rare and it came out well.  No pink at all.  I sent it back and it came back the same way. Ugh!  All in all, it came out to over $120 for the four of us.  My daughter only had a side of the mac and cheese farro, which was actually really good.   I don't see myself going back.

JunWvYKv7ioWpOaPpE6j5Q.text: Healthy food that tastes great! Love the atmosphere. This is a perfect place to meet up with friends who want to eat healthy and have a great time. Highly recommend reservations!

fgJKEWgWG2JvedxYt54Yyg.text: We got here about 1:00 on a Thursday hopping and loud! Bright and cheery place with wonderful outdoor seating ( our fav) we got the avocado hummus which was wonderful and the build your own bowl with chicken that was to die for and the mashed cauliflower and sweet potato hash all wonderful especially the hash!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qrprP3COw-tZvN3OBHkyhQ.text: Let be start by saying this place is gorgeous and I was so excited to try it. However, I never actually got to try any of the food. We had a reservation and were seated promptly, but after that no one ever came back. We sat at our table for 30 minutes. Someone walked by to take our order but then walked away saying that we weren't their table. When we finally decided to leave, they simply said "oh sorry". It was definitely disappointing, luckily the chop shop was next door and saved our hungry stomachs!

cXMwtkIGYQX72W47kYBGGQ.text: The absolute cutest. Love the decor. Love the vibe. The food and drinks are creative and yummy. The people are beautiful. The atmosphere is fun. Highly recommended for a girls' brunch or lunch.

8JSsWOuLgXC6ZFEpkTlQ9Q.text: Great food here!  Had the scrambled eggs with chives sweet potatoes etc. inventive drinks and a great vibe as well and the service was very caring even though they were packed with people when we came in.  Definitely worth a try if you haven't already!

7NoiFqKempeFANsQn9ZFOQ.text: Was passing through from Austin, TX for the day and searched for juice and food. Farm & Craft was only a few blocks from my hotel so I thought I'd walk over and give it a shot. The 2 people at the cash registers were friendly and helpful, along with the Chef Collin. I ordered the Carrot juice and Salmon bowl. Before leaving, the chef ended up striking a conversation with me about this berry jam I was looking at. He grabbed a spoon, opened a jar up and let me try some and then just gave me a brand new jar to take with me. I now am back at my hotel room, just finished the juice and am halfway through this meal.. all I can say is I had a great experience and they serve delicious food. If I'm ever in town again, I'd love to stop back in. Thanks!

sD6zxFlZuwSgPyxYSWy2bw.text: I came here for brunch for the first time and I was pleasantly impressed!! I started off with the Forbidden fruit cocktail and I picked the spicy melon which is habanero vodka mixed inside a small watermelon . I love that fresh watermelon was mixed with vodka. Absolutely delicious!! Then I ordered the breaky burrito which has turkey, scrambled eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese and I added avocado. I loved it!!! And their green hot sauce was to die for!! I would definitely come here again for the fresh, healthy and delicious meals and drinks!!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Forbidden fruit - spicy melon
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. American breakfast w bacon and sweet potato hash
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breaky burrito!! The best!

x5RA3wEXqFOsf0Rs-RpO5g.text: Happy hour here is one to try out, 2-6pm. $5 glasses of Rose, $8 kombucha cocktails, beer specials. A few $6 appetizer specials; I opted for the avocado hummus and the mushroom pizza. I would order both again; perhaps without the greens topping on the pizza. I would also ask for more veggies to be served with the hummus to keep it a bit healthier. Tip: the pizza crust dipped in the hummus is delicious!! Both portions could serve as a full meal for one on their own. If you're looking for a place to do work, this place rocks- lots of plug-ins in the tables across the back wall and free wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushroom pizza- $6 at happy hour
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hummus- $6 at happy hour.. order extra carrots or use pizza crust

kr8qrajdJLo-ogtOFUb4lg.text: Great food for everyone. Our group needed gluten free, vegan, and meatdishes. Farm and Craft can do it all and deliciously fresh unique taste. Our server, Lisa, was knowledgeable about ingredients and about to help meet our needs. Our choices were cashew chicken, chilled pad Thai, and whole roast chicken. Nachos (gluten free) for an appetizer - so good.  The drink menu includes cold pressed juices with awesome combinations. Worth trying something new.

3KP18Msy0gRzAbCC0uGoqA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! It's so hard to find nice not super pricey healthy organic places. I love all the fresh ingredients and super yummie cocktails. I was very impressed with the KOMBUCHA CUCUMBER cocktail. Seriously delish!

0VXXqLBM_1GGbLElC3iqvw.text: This place is awesome!! Not only do they have an exceedingly healthy menu, but they further assist the health conscious by labeling items with specific benefits, such as probiotic increase or anti-inflammatory properties. The fresh made juices are also delicious and very nutritious. It reminds me of a Chop Shop or Flower Child, only classier.   I highly recommend the Cali Chicken bowl and Grilled Pineapple & Bacon Flatbread! We ordered the latter as an appetizer for the table, and upon the first bite, immediately regretted not getting one for myself (as did everyone else at the table!).  The ambience is inviting and intriguing, making this dining experience great for a romantic date or a family gathering. Additionally, they were very accommodating to our party of five. We arrived 12 minutes before the kitchen closed, and they obliged our orders and took our picture even. I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys healthy cuisine that tastes amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Cali Chicken bowl is super delicious!

mVBzAlTnvoI6tIcj4SNMRQ.text: Met the girl crew out last Friday for dinner and drinks. The food/menu theme has a spiffy lifestyle choice for things like anti-inflammatory, stress relief, detox and another I totally forget. We loved the drinks-kudos to the bartender, the drink menu is artisan style! Wine selection pretty concise. App portions good for 4 hungry felines  and most of the options were rather healthy which we are ALL about! We started with the hummus app and a grilled veggie bowl with these great dips. I had one of their Farro based bowls. It has a good flavor but the Farro was served al dente. Thanks to the staff and manager for such a great night!

N5OS6Zl0h6R-UELrorLNCg.text: I've been here twice in the last 6 weeks and both times have been great! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is light and fun. Perfect for a weekend brunch!

nxv2hkToWGRaRyoy5WmP2A.text: Great ambience. Modern, upscale interior. Friendly staff. Had the steak sandwich for lunch and have to say it was one of the best I've had in awhile. I will be back.

MENLadLS_nG0YRKlYgevBA.text: Finally a restaurant/bar in the heart of old town Scottsdale that has great food, awesome vibes and is incredibly healthy. This is my new favorite spot! Highly recommend you check it out!

pQ9SO3wdjsEGawy7jI5MTw.text: I really love the vibe of this place. I really enjoy the rustic salmon bowl and the fresh juices they make in-house. Their craft cocktails are up there with my faves too. I come to Scottsdale a couple of times a month for work and I always make sure to eat here. It's usually a fun place no matter what day of the week.

LG8bEbyduaBsolYgrJjreQ.text: Delicious fresh ingredients. The pay attention to details here, which I love as a restaurant owner myself!

ysI3t3Ms1RWkcIa1b-BXEg.text: So disappointed.  Everything undercooked and under seasoned.  Took 25 min for three bowls to arrive.  All three of us had raw veggies and crispy quinoa .   Only positive was atmosphere and energy in the place.  Might be a great spot to grab a drink but don't waste your money on food here.

ucWAC6q6_tuR8X_GAQV8NQ.text: The food I found to be pretty bland, with nothing spectacular about it. Similar menu design to chop shop, which I find preferable. But the environment and ambiance  are really nice to enjoy a healthy  meal. Good happy hour wine specials.

NDFGkfmunEqUjrobS6puCQ.text: The food is excellent and well thought out. Very healthy breakfast. We plan to return for lunch as the lunch menu looks great too. The fresh pressed juices are a must! Although, the service is a tad slow for how slow the restaurant was this morning.

QTPhGYxUpdw0NXJneLeAmw.text: Really great food and beer on tap.  Loved the Prescott Amber.  Best beer I've ever had!  Service excellent as well.  Much better than the restaurant next door.

svHfEdfItVPo49hLR2yW2w.text: Ahhh moment upon entering! Fresh clean open airy feel- knew we came to the right place for post-workout fuel. Wellness is abundant here. Loved the kale salad w/ salmon, the Greek yogurt parfait with HUGE berries, and our very own flask of hibiscus green tea. Sweet and friendly servers. Will be back for the bar treats and more Mama-daughter time! Affection-food-community

p7tmxoDd3cVZsAInbXiiDw.text: This is a fun place! I felt, sitting at the outside bar, very cool. Like I could sit and sip delicious cocktails all afternoon and have interesting chats with fun strangers. I did an a la carte lunch which was both healthy and super delicious! and I also had menu-envy of my friends' salad, and about everything I saw on everyone else's plate. I have ZERO complaints. Great food, great service, great ambiance, amazing. DEFINITELY going back on the regular!

I6yxY-d5mPsE-NbtM876dg.text: Probably one of our favorite places in old town. Great cocktails and healthy food. Staff is always friendly.

klMkpGzzLZMHCKPkvTQwKg.text: Love the healthy food options here! Wish this could open in Atlanta.  The ambiance is trendy chic, but be careful...because of this, the staff wears too short and small of clothes.  My friends and I couldn't believe the host was wearing a romper 2 sizes too small for her and her whoo haa could be seen.  But it was affordable, comfortable, trendy, and healthy.  The menu is difficult to read and too busy/all over the place, and I wish you could order at a table as I felt rushed to order up front.  Otherwise, great place and yummy healthy food!  Try the avocado lime hummus!!

_rKN9qimc7ZorTgPkDnaSg.text: Farm & Craft has a great vibe! The staff is upbeat and very knowledgeable!  The food was excellent AND healthy! It is a fun and unique concept, almost as unique as their signature cocktails(I had the Kombucha and Tequila)!  The steak sandwich is killer, and I would also recommend their Mac and cheese!  My new favorite spot!

TogfvSjcNTq4Fa3GHWKMOA.text: Waited almost 25 minutes for server to come back to the table to take our order.  Plus a 15 minute wait for a table outside in the heat - no misters.  Food was tasteless, service terrible - will not return.

EatocHEOGxG0X1AjykGFAQ.text: Bartender was awesome and very helpful about area. Good looked fantastic and cocktails were right on the money!! Great spot!

aCjb6zoQFrbW4854TwnU1Q.text: This place is awesome!! Finally something that understands how foods affect the body and also make amazing dishes. A great variety of drinks, salads and entrees and you know it will all be high quality foods. Atmosphere is very trendy as well

JIS7xMwAKAQXSIZW-HnFKA.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. The energy, decor and service were perfect and the food was delectably fresh and delicious. Check this place out - it does not disappoint! We had the breakfast sandwich - egg was perfectly cooked, with nitrate free bacon and fresh avocado slices. The chicken sausage sweet potato hash was perfectly spiced and the sweet potatoes were still firm but not raw. We saw the blueberry protein pancakes at our neighbors table and we went for it. Kris was an impeccable server - attentive and engaging. I will be back and il telling everyone what a great place this is. :)

osXMwDR5pdbCoJQNDuiqfw.text: In the past my boyfriend and I have just absolutely loved this place, we would go every week,but recently things have taken a turn. I am not sure if there is new management or what but we both have noticed some things that have turned us away from going. When you walk in, you are not acknowledged. The hostess who is supposed to check you in always has their back to you which can sometimes feel awkward. The food consistency has also changed. Our meals have been without salad dressing or some meals fail to have all the ingredients stated on the menu. We were regulars so we are pretty familiar with what is supposed to come with and on our meals. Also, the service is so slow and the staff seem to want nothing to do with you. We spend time waiting for silverware or looking for someone to help us pay the bill. I am a bit taken back by the lack of hospitality we have noticed recently. Anyways the food is pretty great and we really enjoyed it before this all happened.

FS_P7WGl5WIuQHEgqLIc1Q.text: Awesome food and great service. Super fresh and very attentive staff.  Definitely a must when in Scottsdale.

1GoEWs0LIZzcFr6CIG8dNA.text: Super cute restaurant, casual service and amazing drinks! However the menu is limited and sever had a hard time answering questions about the menu. Overall a good experience though and the sever made up for the lack of knowledge with his hospitality

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

b65AaG7nuMKzSJpuJNYZQQ.text: We've been at Farm&Craft twice.  First time was weekday.  Got  right in and enjoyed food.  Second time was a Saturday.  Although many tables open, we were told 45 minute wait.  During our wait tables remained open.  Our  45 minute wait extended, we left probably never to return....very good food, but they should get act together.

n0Mocpy0uxgHCVLJs4vx1Q.text: Delicious food that is healthy for you! Breakfast served longer & they have freshly squeezed juices & alcoholic beverages!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great food - very healthy options - friendly staff! I had the American Breakfast for lunch - DELICIOUS!

M1DvK60dBK3Rr9x5AfOCng.text: Absolutely awesome on all levels . Food is amazing ! Service is impressive and clean eating is supported

qkjzSZDcGTi47_qcTZGcbA.text: We were in last night for my 40th birthday with a group of 7.  My husband and I sat at the bar before everyone came and the two bartenders we met were amazing!  Very friendly, offered great suggestions and were easy to chat with.  Then we moved to our table and it was a totally different vibe.  Our server seemed like she didn't want to be there and as far as the details went (bringing plates for the appetizers, getting a drink for the new arrival, asking if we wanted another drink, etc...) she lacked.  I asked her a few questions about ingredients and she had no clue.  I would recommend knowing the menu you are working with.  I've been to the 7th St location a few times and have always had a great experience so we will stick with that one moving forward.  Had a great time with my friends but would have loved a better dinner experience.

rMYYkgZ1F-ugP3WJwAAiUA.text: Couldn't believe that a place that claims to be healthy and anti-inflammatory cannot make a protein dish without canola oil. I, literally, had to go next door to get something to eat and bring it back to eat with my party. They couldn't even steam vegetables or scramble eggs without using canola oil. Who doesn't offer olive oil and vinegar for a salad? They don't. Only canola oil blend. Healthy? I think not. And, the manager had no empathy whatsoever. Just--nope, can't do anything for you. Won't be going back and plan to let other health-conscious friends know so they will avoid as well.

TZk-e8jlpHoA_4ebtCzuLw.text: Amazing food and drink menu... I could have had one of everything! Portion sizes were good as well. I was an out-of-town guest. We went to several restraurants during our 4 day visit. This was definitely a fav!

aHgBHbBWotC1Owee8ihm8A.text: Visiting from Atlanta and it was my second day in Scottsdale.  My friends and I were walking and exploring the city and decided to stop in and have some drinks.  The staff was very friendly and greeted us immediately upon walking in and it was quite busy.  We decided to sit at the bar side patio because it was nice day. The cocktails were amazing but the bartender Jody was absolutely phenomenal.  Jody's service along with her drinks are just amazing. Very knowledgeable about the food, beverages and things to do in the area. Over all I am extremely happy I came here and everyone should check out Farm and Craft and say hello to Jody.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best fresh pressed juice cocktail I have ever had. It&#39;s called &#34;The Cure.&#34;  Very refreshing cocktail.

51a0lPRtWKqpRQZ6Di71gA.text: Loved the healthy options available! Their salmon was cooked perfectly and their juices were fresh! I wish I had a location closer to me....but anytime I'm near old town Scottsdale I am eating here for a healthy lunch!

vkWdd7Hplg90ePxYXHT0DQ.text: Great food and even better cocktails! It is a little pricey, but they've got a full bar, friendly bartenders, fresh squeezed juice, and an incredible California-y atmosphere with floor to ceiling windows. I got the tasty sweet potatoes hash dish and the cocktails we had (watermelon type of drink and one with cucumber and vodka) were absolutely delicious!

CdeUmBvRKdQdJ6UalhuCew.text: I used to frequent Farm and Craft quite often and always enjoyed the food, service and ambiance - but over time, the shine has tarnished. It's as though they willingly go out if their way to drive away potential customers.  1. A few weeks ago, I brought a few health-oriented friends who were excited about their menu and eager to try their food. We park a block away and hear this god awful auto-tuned club music blaring. It sounded like chainsaws and wood chippers set to a beat. I joke that the W pool party must be raging, but as we get closer, it's coming from Farm and Craft! We are young, we like music, but this was SO LOUD and obnoxious total crap music blaring that it was downright hilarious.  The music literally pushed us all away and we disappointedly went elsewhere for brunch.  2. A friend and I were craving grass-fed burgers and we've always liked the ones served at Farm and Craft.  As we walk to door, we see several open tables both outside on the patio as well as inside. The host informs us there is a 15 - 20 minute wait. What?  Open tables all clean and set with silverware and yet we must wait? We left and went elsewhere.   Basically, I want to eat at Farm and Craft, but the damn place keeps pushing me and my friends away.  Now I go to Modern Market just down the street because they are always up for serving healthy food to willing customers.

WBKRdRCxlljP74iFX4xq7A.text: Raw pad Thai w/ salmon: amazing!  Love Pad Thai but was skeptical about the raw thing but wow!  Hummus was a little bland but the main courses made this 5

VDR8h7XO2lzNC8ymg6ESPg.text: My boyfriend and I went to this location for the first time! Absolutely amazing! Kyle recommended the brussels sprouts and what a blessing that was!!!! We will definitely back for the delicious food and unforgettable service!

NSzVTND5c_GY3n7_taHokw.text: Great for people with dietary restrictions and preferences. Good service, cool ambience, and great location (old town Scottsdale). Good for groups and for kids, too. We'll be going back.

6gbjUYQtgYBOHFYjY-JfPQ.text: I have been wanting to try Farm and Craft since they opened in Old Town, and I FINALLY made it there. The menu looked wonderful but with many dietary restrictions, there was not a whole lot I could chose from. I ended up with the burger and it was cooked beautifully. Our server, Jake, was great. He let me try all of their teas and gave me one to go. He was attentive and efficient. I will be back!

B7elRKGsclEEi117ej6QaQ.text: We went there first for drinks at a Phoenix location.  The bartender was great and spent a good amount of time educating us about both the restaurant and the area.  The drinks are creative and good.  The next day we had breakfast at the Scottsdale location based on the bartender's sales pitch and were not disappointed.   It was wonderful to have a good healthy and tasty breakfast.  Tip:  order mimosas on the weekend.   You'll see why when you get there.

SNoTMOpRyw5zUIOtpKuC2g.text: This place is very modern and has a fun unique vibe. I enjoyed the service of the staff and the restaurant was spacious.   The food was awesome but lacked options. In fact it's pretty small and the happy hour menu has only a handful of options. But for what its worth its still a good value and the food tastes great. I really wish the chairs were more comfortable for you can't have it all. Overall great place to share a bite and a drink.

k2i5wlDEVmmNl47wpp_CNA.text: Enjoyed it very much from the last couple visits. They appear to use cleaner and non gmo'd ingredients for a good value convenient to our home. Thank you

q6Qh2M9fltlJVZ57UUcSLw.text: 1. There are two entrances, one of which does not have anyone there to point you to the right direction.  2. One of the waitresses cut off another while they were walking away with dishes and the other rolled her eyes and called her a 'f***ing b***h'. Pretty unsettling for brunch time. 3. There seemed to be a disconnect between the hostess and the waiter/waitress team as about 1/3 of the seating were open, but there was at least 10 of us still waiting to be seated. I know sometimes restaurants do this to look like they're a hot spot that's busy, but this wasn't working. 4. Our waiter was nice and knew his stuff, but seemed to be out of it as well as he missed a few details in my order like not bringing any cream with my coffee.   Overall I think this place has a lot of potential, beautiful design, great healthy food, but needs to be better managed to clean up the edges.

co-v9X_4BG1zEYoXMwJnIQ.text: Things started out well. We were seated for lunch right away. Our adorable server was so sweet and helpful with deciding on our menu selections. We each ordered an entree, my girlfriend ordered a cocktail. He brought her her drink ( i was drinking water) That was the last time our server came to the table  When our food was ready, a different server brought the food. No one checked to see if the food was ok (it was ). Never got a fill on our water. We even sat for quite awhile with our plates empty until we finally asked a different server to get our waiter to get a check. That waiter forgot to grab our original server so we waited longer. Then we grabbed that server again and asked him for our check (we had been done eating for at least 20 min now). He apologized and told us that our server was training to be a manager so he was real busy (my friend had been watching him chatting about tattoos and socializing with the table behind us). If he in fact was training to be a manager he is going to be a horrible manager. Like I said he started out great, but the impression from our visit will prevent either of us from going back

t0p6VCumk4X2QP4HO7Piug.text: If you have hours to kill, this may be your spot.  The cocktails were delicious, but the service was so slow, it would be impossible to fail a field sobriety test.  They ran out of many ingredients for their signature cocktails. The food was only okay, but damn, that service was slow and inattentive.

2a7SJL2iRdINNjjzT0bAwA.text: I never write yelp reviews, but i feel that Farm & Craft deserves one. With so much competition in the valley, I was hesitant F&C would be over shadowed... Boy was I wrong! This place is killer! I have become a bit addicted, and am working my way through the menu. Here are my favorites from each section of the menu so far-  Bowls: Rustic Farm Bowl served with basil kale pesto.. such a game changer! Wraps: Turkey Wrap is UNREAL. The flax pita is truly the best I have had in the valley. It has a little sweet kick which I love.  Build Your Own: Vegan Honey Roasted Carrots... words cannot describe how delicious these are! I had to order two extra sides after the first time I had them! I also got the Sweet Potato Hash, Farro Mac & Cheese, and the Garbanzo beans and goat cheese, with chicken. All super tasty!  Salads: KALE CESAR. Living in the scottsdale/arcadia area, the word "kale" has become as popular as water at restaurants. However, this is the best kale salad hands down!!!   I also tried the chocolate protein shake yesterday and it was so delicious. Sweet but refreshing, and healthy!   I have never felt so passionate about a new concept! It is seriously amazing every time I go in. I love how from open-3pm it is fast casual, but then 3pm- close is full service. It is the perfect balance because sometimes Friday night rolls around and you want healthy food, but still a nice, fun environment. Farm & Craft is the place!!

yumPUcUnqYrLcL2Pg0JFtA.text: Beautiful restaurant that feels like you are at the Sheridan poolside bar in Waikiki....thats the vibe I got. Loved the food and I thought the service was friendly and prompt. I came twice on my 3 day stay in AZ, loved the breakfast menu options. They also have wifi which is really nice. Not sure why they have received harsh reviews but I look forward to coming back and trying more of the menu when I am in town.

EN9J74-GM2Wbo_8RLARBXg.text: Discovered this place on a whim last week and I've been here 3 times now for breakfast and dinner! Highly recommend the build your own steak and farro Mac n cheese as a dinner entree. It's cheap for a delicious meal! Sometimes the portions can be a little small, but I understand this place endorses health eating so it's never an issue!

vrXWE-UCwpS2jBjzxOzrQQ.text: I was here today and love so much about this place! It's got a very modern and cute ambiance, got a table right away (at 11am on a Sunday even), the service is fabulous, and the food is amazing (and healthy). Loved it! The only reason why not five stars is the music is so loud you definitely find yourself having to kind of shout and say "huh" with people your trying to catch up with. Nice music, but people want to have conversation while their eating at your fabulous place too. You sign says "All I want is food and affection." Well the affection part needs to happen there while shouting! Lol. That is the only negative though...great over all! Glad I went!!

BzGEMpVaLxmXd4myHQTieg.text: Farm & Craft was an excellent choice for a night of solo dining on my recent business trip. Cool ambience, with an indoor tree as a centerpiece, and open concept! The bartender was super friendly and personable. Food was excellent! It was great to have some healthy, clean food after a week of eating junk! Highly recommend!

2HxnBFbddYwIxfml5Kx0mQ.text: I've been here a few times with my wife and have even stopped in solo while traveling for work. They have a great vibe a dinner date or just to hang out and get some dinner and a glass of wine.  LOVE the greek salad.  One of my favs!

BhmEKkE1tl4-TA8U7uBp1g.text: Food is pretty good. Very cute design. Love the open design and the patio. We have had some problems with some of the staff when ordering to go food. I did call at one point and talk to a manager he was fantastic and handled everything. I know mistakes happen but it is how a company deals with them and this manager was great. But because we have issues with almost every order I can't give 5 stars. Someone did tell me a couple of the girls at the front were new and still being trained. Hoping everything thing gets fix and this will be a fantastic place!

MJUeIrffuu2NYwvFda66tA.text: Love this place! They have great specialty drinks and the food is excellent! Ambience is great and the location couldn't be better! Great date night spot or a place to meet friends for drinks and food. Great vibes :)

YudJ_ztYxqiE19Mj7RR1Pg.text: Food was delicious. Service was sub par. Hoping it was because they were understaffed. We will go back and give it another try because of how good the food was- but we were disappointed with how slow the service was. On a positive note- the decor is clean and the flowers are beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm & Craft - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California chicken bowl.

y4JnpMT1zgqizft9NvyXOQ.text: I was so excited to try this place- unfortunately, it didn't live up to the expectation.  Don't get me wrong - it's a neat concept and the decor is kind of cool.  Service was sub-par at best.  Although we may have just had a poor server - the rest of the tables appeared happy with their service.  The beer taps weren't working because it was too warm???  Agreed it was hot out but when you're a craft beer business I would think that might be something you consider in Phoenix AZ.  The food was ok - interesting and certainly fresh.  We had a mushroom flatbread that was way too heavy in truffle oil and arugula and way too light in mushrooms while the crust was tasteless.  The roasted chicken was - well, weak at best.  Over cooked and tough.    The concept certainly is interesting but I won't be back.  It pales to any other farm to table restaurants I've eaten at.  And the craft selection even if working was poor.

A0Yhtml8f4Tv2WcCD3qQqA.text: Farm and Craft is absolutely delicious. The Kombucha cocktails are amazing. Would definitely recommend checking out this new restaurant.

6qHZLzSfIKTl9NQ9ujeX8Q.text: I thought the food was good, but overpriced. The friends that were with me waited extremely long for their order only to find out that it had been lost. There was no apology, no offer to make it right, just a bit more waiting for the food.

iLA7FeZY7vC2ptg3nN7Dqw.text: I had passed by this restaurant for several nights before checking it out and now I'm kicking myself because it's SO GOOD. I had the subtly spicy sweet potato and blue cheese flatbread, the spinach and goat cheese salad with steak, and Brussels sprouts with bacon and walnuts. I wanted more but this was already more than I could eat, and man am I looking forward to the leftovers. Great food, fair price, delicious cocktail and excellent service.

QGYX1hazIfHym4SD9GxqiQ.text: The poke bowl was deliciously fresh!  Would 100% recommend this dish and the Farm & Craft establishment!  Great patio with a nice bar!  I would eat here again for sure!

60bogNExprejOz6rKICnCg.text: So we decided not to believe the yelp reviews. That was the first mistake we made. We showed up on Sunday at 9 AM the restaurant was half empty. Next we ordered our food after waiting 15 minutes for a waitress to take our order. Next we waited 35 minutes before food showed up. It was cold. Next we actually tasted our food and it was the bland with no flavor and grossly overpriced for what it was. We ordered coffee and sugar. We waited 10 minutes to get our sugar. At that point the coffee was cold as well. We wait another 10 minutes for a waitress to come back but she didn't so we had to go to the front And ask for a check. It's funny as we were leaving that the person next to us asked a different waitress to make the food again because it was cold.....We will never go back.... please be smart and trust the yelp reviews. I don't like to review places that don't deserve it but it's worth mentioning that the place and location are trendy and nice.

J6t-wCRpiHIsPsqQEOKRjw.text: Love the ambience here. Healthy kamboucha drinks!!!!Flexible menu if you have any gluten and dairy restrictions ++++ Food is delicious. Highly recommend their flat bread and chocolate chia pudding. Friendly servers. Everything in this place is almost perfect.

FVcZ2xvnzghU22JCOJpT9w.text: All I can say is "piss poor service".  We ordered immediately when we sat down. It's 45min later and we still don't have food.   Asked the waiter and he said he'd check on it. He comes back and says the order was cancelled.  He didn't know why...

y44OvqW47E3o-kYZCw298w.text: Great atmosphere, sincere server who was kind and helpful with the menu, live DJ, and the food was delicious. I'll definitely be back.
